verses.name: Luke 1:1
verses.text: Many have undertaken to draw up an account of the things that have been fulfilled among us,

verses.name: Luke 1:2
verses.text: just as they were handed down to us by those who from the first were eyewitnesses and servants of the word.

verses.name: Luke 1:3
verses.text: Therefore, since I myself have carefully investigated everything from the beginning, it seemed good also to me to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,

verses.name: Luke 1:4
verses.text: so that you may know the certainty of the things you have been taught.

verses.name: Luke 1:5
verses.text: In the time of Herod king of Judea there was a priest named Zechariah, who belonged to the priestly division of Abijah; his wife Elizabeth was also a descendant of Aaron.

verses.name: Luke 1:6
verses.text: Both of them were upright in the sight of God, observing all the Lord's commandments and regulations blamelessly.

verses.name: Luke 1:7
verses.text: But they had no children, because Elizabeth was barren; and they were both well along in years.

verses.name: Luke 1:8
verses.text: Once when Zechariah's division was on duty and he was serving as priest before God,

verses.name: Luke 1:9
verses.text: he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.

verses.name: Luke 1:10
verses.text: And when the time for the burning of incense came, all the assembled worshipers were praying outside.

verses.name: Luke 1:11
verses.text: Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing at the right side of the altar of incense.

verses.name: Luke 1:12
verses.text: When Zechariah saw him, he was startled and was gripped with fear.

verses.name: Luke 1:13
verses.text: But the angel said to him: "Do not be afraid, Zechariah; your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you are to give him the name John.

verses.name: Luke 1:14
verses.text: He will be a joy and delight to you, and many will rejoice because of his birth,

verses.name: Luke 1:15
verses.text: for he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He is never to take wine or other fermented drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit even from birth.

verses.name: Luke 1:16
verses.text: Many of the people of Israel will he bring back to the Lord their God.

verses.name: Luke 1:17
verses.text: And he will go on before the Lord, in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous--to make ready a people prepared for the Lord."

verses.name: Luke 1:18
verses.text: Zechariah asked the angel, "How can I be sure of this? I am an old man and my wife is well along in years."

verses.name: Luke 1:19
verses.text: The angel answered, "I am Gabriel. I stand in the presence of God, and I have been sent to speak to you and to tell you this good news.

verses.name: Luke 1:20
verses.text: And now you will be silent and not able to speak until the day this happens, because you did not believe my words, which will come true at their proper time."

verses.name: Luke 1:21
verses.text: Meanwhile, the people were waiting for Zechariah and wondering why he stayed so long in the temple.

verses.name: Luke 1:22
verses.text: When he came out, he could not speak to them. They realized he had seen a vision in the temple, for he kept making signs to them but remained unable to speak.

verses.name: Luke 1:23
verses.text: When his time of service was completed, he returned home.

verses.name: Luke 1:24
verses.text: After this his wife Elizabeth became pregnant and for five months remained in seclusion.

verses.name: Luke 1:25
verses.text: "The Lord has done this for me," she said. "In these days he has shown his favor and taken away my disgrace among the people."

verses.name: Luke 1:26
verses.text: In the sixth month, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee,

verses.name: Luke 1:27
verses.text: to a virgin pledged to be married to a man named Joseph, a descendant of David. The virgin's name was Mary.

verses.name: Luke 1:28
verses.text: The angel went to her and said, "Greetings, you who are highly favored! The Lord is with you."

verses.name: Luke 1:29
verses.text: Mary was greatly troubled at his words and wondered what kind of greeting this might be.

verses.name: Luke 1:30
verses.text: But the angel said to her, "Do not be afraid, Mary, you have found favor with God.

verses.name: Luke 1:31
verses.text: You will be with child and give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus.

verses.name: Luke 1:32
verses.text: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father David,

verses.name: Luke 1:33
verses.text: and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever; his kingdom will never end."

verses.name: Luke 1:34
verses.text: "How will this be," Mary asked the angel, "since I am a virgin?"

verses.name: Luke 1:35
verses.text: The angel answered, "The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. So the holy one to be born will be called the Son of God.

verses.name: Luke 1:36
verses.text: Even Elizabeth your relative is going to have a child in her old age, and she who was said to be barren is in her sixth month.

verses.name: Luke 1:37
verses.text: For nothing is impossible with God."

verses.name: Luke 1:38
verses.text: "I am the Lord's servant," Mary answered. "May it be to me as you have said." Then the angel left her.

verses.name: Luke 1:39
verses.text: At that time Mary got ready and hurried to a town in the hill country of Judea,

verses.name: Luke 1:40
verses.text: where she entered Zechariah's home and greeted Elizabeth.

verses.name: Luke 1:41
verses.text: When Elizabeth heard Mary's greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Luke 1:42
verses.text: In a loud voice she exclaimed: "Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the child you will bear!

verses.name: Luke 1:43
verses.text: But why am I so favored, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

verses.name: Luke 1:44
verses.text: As soon as the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.

verses.name: Luke 1:45
verses.text: Blessed is she who has believed that what the Lord has said to her will be accomplished!"

verses.name: Luke 1:46
verses.text: And Mary said: "My soul glorifies the Lord

verses.name: Luke 1:47
verses.text: and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior,

verses.name: Luke 1:48
verses.text: for he has been mindful of the humble state of his servant. From now on all generations will call me blessed,

verses.name: Luke 1:49
verses.text: for the Mighty One has done great things for me--holy is his name.

verses.name: Luke 1:50
verses.text: His mercy extends to those who fear him, from generation to generation.

verses.name: Luke 1:51
verses.text: He has performed mighty deeds with his arm; he has scattered those who are proud in their inmost thoughts.

verses.name: Luke 1:52
verses.text: He has brought down rulers from their thrones but has lifted up the humble.

verses.name: Luke 1:53
verses.text: He has filled the hungry with good things but has sent the rich away empty.

verses.name: Luke 1:54
verses.text: He has helped his servant Israel, remembering to be merciful

verses.name: Luke 1:55
verses.text: to Abraham and his descendants forever, even as he said to our fathers."

verses.name: Luke 1:56
verses.text: Mary stayed with Elizabeth for about three months and then returned home.

verses.name: Luke 1:57
verses.text: When it was time for Elizabeth to have her baby, she gave birth to a son.

verses.name: Luke 1:58
verses.text: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown her great mercy, and they shared her joy.

verses.name: Luke 1:59
verses.text: On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they were going to name him after his father Zechariah,

verses.name: Luke 1:60
verses.text: but his mother spoke up and said, "No! He is to be called John."

verses.name: Luke 1:61
verses.text: They said to her, "There is no one among your relatives who has that name."

verses.name: Luke 1:62
verses.text: Then they made signs to his father, to find out what he would like to name the child.

verses.name: Luke 1:63
verses.text: He asked for a writing tablet, and to everyone's astonishment he wrote, "His name is John."

verses.name: Luke 1:64
verses.text: Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue was loosed, and he began to speak, praising God.

verses.name: Luke 1:65
verses.text: The neighbors were all filled with awe, and throughout the hill country of Judea people were talking about all these things.

verses.name: Luke 1:66
verses.text: Everyone who heard this wondered about it, asking, "What then is this child going to be?" For the Lord's hand was with him.

verses.name: Luke 1:67
verses.text: His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied:

verses.name: Luke 1:68
verses.text: "Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, because he has come and has redeemed his people.

verses.name: Luke 1:69
verses.text: He has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David

verses.name: Luke 1:70
verses.text: (as he said through his holy prophets of long ago),

verses.name: Luke 1:71
verses.text: salvation from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us--

verses.name: Luke 1:72
verses.text: to show mercy to our fathers and to remember his holy covenant,

verses.name: Luke 1:73
verses.text: the oath he swore to our father Abraham:

verses.name: Luke 1:74
verses.text: to rescue us from the hand of our enemies, and to enable us to serve him without fear

verses.name: Luke 1:75
verses.text: in holiness and righteousness before him all our days.

verses.name: Luke 1:76
verses.text: And you, my child, will be called a prophet of the Most High; for you will go on before the Lord to prepare the way for him,

verses.name: Luke 1:77
verses.text: to give his people the knowledge of salvation through the forgiveness of their sins,

verses.name: Luke 1:78
verses.text: because of the tender mercy of our God, by which the rising sun will come to us from heaven

verses.name: Luke 1:79
verses.text: to shine on those living in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the path of peace."

verses.name: Luke 1:80
verses.text: And the child grew and became strong in spirit; and he lived in the desert until he appeared publicly to Israel.

verses.name: Luke 2:1
verses.text: In those days Caesar Augustus issued a decree that a census should be taken of the entire Roman world.

verses.name: Luke 2:2
verses.text: (This was the first census that took place while Quirinius was governor of Syria.)

verses.name: Luke 2:3
verses.text: And everyone went to his own town to register.

verses.name: Luke 2:4
verses.text: So Joseph also went up from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to Bethlehem the town of David, because he belonged to the house and line of David.

verses.name: Luke 2:5
verses.text: He went there to register with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him and was expecting a child.

verses.name: Luke 2:6
verses.text: While they were there, the time came for the baby to be born,

verses.name: Luke 2:7
verses.text: and she gave birth to her firstborn, a son. She wrapped him in cloths and placed him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.

verses.name: Luke 2:8
verses.text: And there were shepherds living out in the fields nearby, keeping watch over their flocks at night.

verses.name: Luke 2:9
verses.text: An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.

verses.name: Luke 2:10
verses.text: But the angel said to them, "Do not be afraid. I bring you good news of great joy that will be for all the people.

verses.name: Luke 2:11
verses.text: Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; he is Christ the Lord.

verses.name: Luke 2:12
verses.text: This will be a sign to you: You will find a baby wrapped in cloths and lying in a manger."

verses.name: Luke 2:13
verses.text: Suddenly a great company of the heavenly host appeared with the angel, praising God and saying,

verses.name: Luke 2:14
verses.text: "Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace to men on whom his favor rests."

verses.name: Luke 2:15
verses.text: When the angels had left them and gone into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, "Let's go to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has told us about."

verses.name: Luke 2:16
verses.text: So they hurried off and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby, who was lying in the manger.

verses.name: Luke 2:17
verses.text: When they had seen him, they spread the word concerning what had been told them about this child,

verses.name: Luke 2:18
verses.text: and all who heard it were amazed at what the shepherds said to them.

verses.name: Luke 2:19
verses.text: But Mary treasured up all these things and pondered them in her heart.

verses.name: Luke 2:20
verses.text: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, which were just as they had been told.

verses.name: Luke 2:21
verses.text: On the eighth day, when it was time to circumcise him, he was named Jesus, the name the angel had given him before he had been conceived.

verses.name: Luke 2:22
verses.text: When the time of their purification according to the Law of Moses had been completed, Joseph and Mary took him to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord

verses.name: Luke 2:23
verses.text: (as it is written in the Law of the Lord, "Every firstborn male is to be consecrated to the Lord" ),

verses.name: Luke 2:24
verses.text: and to offer a sacrifice in keeping with what is said in the Law of the Lord: "a pair of doves or two young pigeons."

verses.name: Luke 2:25
verses.text: Now there was a man in Jerusalem called Simeon, who was righteous and devout. He was waiting for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.

verses.name: Luke 2:26
verses.text: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he had seen the Lord's Christ.

verses.name: Luke 2:27
verses.text: Moved by the Spirit, he went into the temple courts. When the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for him what the custom of the Law required,

verses.name: Luke 2:28
verses.text: Simeon took him in his arms and praised God, saying:

verses.name: Luke 2:29
verses.text: "Sovereign Lord, as you have promised, you now dismiss your servant in peace.

verses.name: Luke 2:30
verses.text: For my eyes have seen your salvation,

verses.name: Luke 2:31
verses.text: which you have prepared in the sight of all people,

verses.name: Luke 2:32
verses.text: a light for revelation to the Gentiles and for glory to your people Israel."

verses.name: Luke 2:33
verses.text: The child's father and mother marveled at what was said about him.

verses.name: Luke 2:34
verses.text: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, his mother: "This child is destined to cause the falling and rising of many in Israel, and to be a sign that will be spoken against,

verses.name: Luke 2:35
verses.text: so that the thoughts of many hearts will be revealed. And a sword will pierce your own soul too."

verses.name: Luke 2:36
verses.text: There was also a prophetess, Anna, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old; she had lived with her husband seven years after her marriage,

verses.name: Luke 2:37
verses.text: and then was a widow until she was eighty-four. She never left the temple but worshiped night and day, fasting and praying.

verses.name: Luke 2:38
verses.text: Coming up to them at that very moment, she gave thanks to God and spoke about the child to all who were looking forward to the redemption of Jerusalem.

verses.name: Luke 2:39
verses.text: When Joseph and Mary had done everything required by the Law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee to their own town of Nazareth.

verses.name: Luke 2:40
verses.text: And the child grew and became strong; he was filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him.

verses.name: Luke 2:41
verses.text: Every year his parents went to Jerusalem for the Feast of the Passover.

verses.name: Luke 2:42
verses.text: When he was twelve years old, they went up to the Feast, according to the custom.

verses.name: Luke 2:43
verses.text: After the Feast was over, while his parents were returning home, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, but they were unaware of it.

verses.name: Luke 2:44
verses.text: Thinking he was in their company, they traveled on for a day. Then they began looking for him among their relatives and friends.

verses.name: Luke 2:45
verses.text: When they did not find him, they went back to Jerusalem to look for him.

verses.name: Luke 2:46
verses.text: After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.

verses.name: Luke 2:47
verses.text: Everyone who heard him was amazed at his understanding and his answers.

verses.name: Luke 2:48
verses.text: When his parents saw him, they were astonished. His mother said to him, "Son, why have you treated us like this? Your father and I have been anxiously searching for you."

verses.name: Luke 2:49
verses.text: "Why were you searching for me?" he asked. "Didn't you know I had to be in my Father's house?"

verses.name: Luke 2:50
verses.text: But they did not understand what he was saying to them.

verses.name: Luke 2:51
verses.text: Then he went down to Nazareth with them and was obedient to them. But his mother treasured all these things in her heart.

verses.name: Luke 2:52
verses.text: And Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.

verses.name: Luke 3:1
verses.text: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar--when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, Herod tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and Traconitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene--

verses.name: Luke 3:2
verses.text: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John son of Zechariah in the desert.

verses.name: Luke 3:3
verses.text: He went into all the country around the Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

verses.name: Luke 3:4
verses.text: As is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet: "A voice of one calling in the desert, 'Prepare the way for the Lord, make straight paths for him.

verses.name: Luke 3:5
verses.text: Every valley shall be filled in, every mountain and hill made low. The crooked roads shall become straight, the rough ways smooth.

verses.name: Luke 3:6
verses.text: And all mankind will see God's salvation.'"

verses.name: Luke 3:7
verses.text: John said to the crowds coming out to be baptized by him, "You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?

verses.name: Luke 3:8
verses.text: Produce fruit in keeping with repentance. And do not begin to say to yourselves, 'We have Abraham as our father.' For I tell you that out of these stones God can raise up children for Abraham.

verses.name: Luke 3:9
verses.text: The ax is already at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire."

verses.name: Luke 3:10
verses.text: "What should we do then?" the crowd asked.

verses.name: Luke 3:11
verses.text: John answered, "The man with two tunics should share with him who has none, and the one who has food should do the same."

verses.name: Luke 3:12
verses.text: Tax collectors also came to be baptized. "Teacher," they asked, "what should we do?"

verses.name: Luke 3:13
verses.text: "Don't collect any more than you are required to," he told

verses.name: Luke 3:14
verses.text: them. Then some soldiers asked him, "And what should we do?" He replied, "Don't extort money and don't accuse people falsely--be content with your pay."

verses.name: Luke 3:15
verses.text: The people were waiting expectantly and were all wondering in their hearts if John might possibly be the Christ.

verses.name: Luke 3:16
verses.text: John answered them all, "I baptize you with water. But one more powerful than I will come, the thongs of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.

verses.name: Luke 3:17
verses.text: His winnowing fork is in his hand to clear his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his barn, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire."

verses.name: Luke 3:18
verses.text: And with many other words John exhorted the people and preached the good news to them.

verses.name: Luke 3:19
verses.text: But when John rebuked Herod the tetrarch because of Herodias, his brother's wife, and all the other evil things he had done,

verses.name: Luke 3:20
verses.text: Herod added this to them all: He locked John up in prison.

verses.name: Luke 3:21
verses.text: When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. And as he was praying, heaven was opened

verses.name: Luke 3:22
verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven: "You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased."

verses.name: Luke 3:23
verses.text: Now Jesus himself was about thirty years old when he began his ministry. He was the son, so it was thought, of Joseph,

verses.name: Luke 3:24
verses.text: the son of Heli, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melki, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,

verses.name: Luke 3:25
verses.text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli,

verses.name: Luke 3:26
verses.text: the son of Naggai, the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,

verses.name: Luke 3:27
verses.text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel,

verses.name: Luke 3:28
verses.text: the son of Neri, the son of Melki, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,

verses.name: Luke 3:29
verses.text: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat,

verses.name: Luke 3:30
verses.text: the son of Levi, the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,

verses.name: Luke 3:31
verses.text: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan,

verses.name: Luke 3:32
verses.text: the son of David, the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,

verses.name: Luke 3:33
verses.text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez,

verses.name: Luke 3:34
verses.text: the son of Judah, the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,

verses.name: Luke 3:35
verses.text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber,

verses.name: Luke 3:36
verses.text: the son of Shelah, the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,

verses.name: Luke 3:37
verses.text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel,

verses.name: Luke 3:38
verses.text: the son of Kenan, the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.

verses.name: Luke 4:1
verses.text: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit in the desert,

verses.name: Luke 4:2
verses.text: where for forty days he was tempted by the devil. He ate nothing during those days, and at the end of them he was hungry.

verses.name: Luke 4:3
verses.text: The devil said to him, "If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread."

verses.name: Luke 4:4
verses.text: Jesus answered, "It is written: 'Man does not live on bread alone.'"

verses.name: Luke 4:5
verses.text: The devil led him up to a high place and showed him in an instant all the kingdoms of the world.

verses.name: Luke 4:6
verses.text: And he said to him, "I will give you all their authority and splendor, for it has been given to me, and I can give it to anyone I want to.

verses.name: Luke 4:7
verses.text: So if you worship me, it will all be yours."

verses.name: Luke 4:8
verses.text: Jesus answered, "It is written: 'Worship the Lord your God and serve him only.'"

verses.name: Luke 4:9
verses.text: The devil led him to Jerusalem and had him stand on the highest point of the temple. "If you are the Son of God," he said, "throw yourself down from here.

verses.name: Luke 4:10
verses.text: For it is written: "'He will command his angels concerning you to guard you carefully;

verses.name: Luke 4:11
verses.text: they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.'"

verses.name: Luke 4:12
verses.text: Jesus answered, "It says: 'Do not put the Lord your God to the test.'"

verses.name: Luke 4:13
verses.text: When the devil had finished all this tempting, he left him until an opportune time.

verses.name: Luke 4:14
verses.text: Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and news about him spread through the whole countryside.

verses.name: Luke 4:15
verses.text: He taught in their synagogues, and everyone praised him.

verses.name: Luke 4:16
verses.text: He went to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and on the Sabbath day he went into the synagogue, as was his custom. And he stood up to read.

verses.name: Luke 4:17
verses.text: The scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. Unrolling it, he found the place where it is written:

verses.name: Luke 4:18
verses.text: "The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim freedom for the prisoners and recovery of sight for the blind, to release the oppressed,

verses.name: Luke 4:19
verses.text: to proclaim the year of the Lord's favor."

verses.name: Luke 4:20
verses.text: Then he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant and sat down. The eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fastened on him,

verses.name: Luke 4:21
verses.text: and he began by saying to them, "Today this scripture is fulfilled in your hearing."

verses.name: Luke 4:22
verses.text: All spoke well of him and were amazed at the gracious words that came from his lips. "Isn't this Joseph's son?" they asked.

verses.name: Luke 4:23
verses.text: Jesus said to them, "Surely you will quote this proverb to me: 'Physician, heal yourself! Do here in your hometown what we have heard that you did in Capernaum.'"

verses.name: Luke 4:24
verses.text: "I tell you the truth," he continued, "no prophet is accepted in his hometown.

verses.name: Luke 4:25
verses.text: I assure you that there were many widows in Israel in Elijah's time, when the sky was shut for three and a half years and there was a severe famine throughout the land.

verses.name: Luke 4:26
verses.text: Yet Elijah was not sent to any of them, but to a widow in Zarephath in the region of Sidon.

verses.name: Luke 4:27
verses.text: And there were many in Israel with leprosy in the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was cleansed--only Naaman the Syrian."

verses.name: Luke 4:28
verses.text: All the people in the synagogue were furious when they heard this.

verses.name: Luke 4:29
verses.text: They got up, drove him out of the town, and took him to the brow of the hill on which the town was built, in order to throw him down the cliff.

verses.name: Luke 4:30
verses.text: But he walked right through the crowd and went on his way.

verses.name: Luke 4:31
verses.text: Then he went down to Capernaum, a town in Galilee, and on the Sabbath began to teach the people.

verses.name: Luke 4:32
verses.text: They were amazed at his teaching, because his message had authority.

verses.name: Luke 4:33
verses.text: In the synagogue there was a man possessed by a demon, an evil spirit. He cried out at the top of his voice,

verses.name: Luke 4:34
verses.text: "Ha! What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are--the Holy One of God!"

verses.name: Luke 4:35
verses.text: "Be quiet!" Jesus said sternly. "Come out of him!" Then the demon threw the man down before them all and came out without injuring him.

verses.name: Luke 4:36
verses.text: All the people were amazed and said to each other, "What is this teaching? With authority and power he gives orders to evil spirits and they come out!"

verses.name: Luke 4:37
verses.text: And the news about him spread throughout the surrounding area.

verses.name: Luke 4:38
verses.text: Jesus left the synagogue and went to the home of Simon. Now Simon's mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.

verses.name: Luke 4:39
verses.text: So he bent over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. She got up at once and began to wait on them.

verses.name: Luke 4:40
verses.text: When the sun was setting, the people brought to Jesus all who had various kinds of sickness, and laying his hands on each one, he healed them.

verses.name: Luke 4:41
verses.text: Moreover, demons came out of many people, shouting, "You are the Son of God!" But he rebuked them and would not allow them to speak, because they knew he was the Christ.

verses.name: Luke 4:42
verses.text: At daybreak Jesus went out to a solitary place. The people were looking for him and when they came to where he was, they tried to keep him from leaving them.

verses.name: Luke 4:43
verses.text: But he said, "I must preach the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns also, because that is why I was sent."

verses.name: Luke 4:44
verses.text: And he kept on preaching in the synagogues of Judea.

verses.name: Luke 5:1
verses.text: One day as Jesus was standing by the Lake of Gennesaret, with the people crowding around him and listening to the word of God,

verses.name: Luke 5:2
verses.text: he saw at the water's edge two boats, left there by the fishermen, who were washing their nets.

verses.name: Luke 5:3
verses.text: He got into one of the boats, the one belonging to Simon, and asked him to put out a little from shore. Then he sat down and taught the people from the boat.

verses.name: Luke 5:4
verses.text: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, "Put out into deep water, and let down the nets for a catch."

verses.name: Luke 5:5
verses.text: Simon answered, "Master, we've worked hard all night and haven't caught anything. But because you say so, I will let down the nets."

verses.name: Luke 5:6
verses.text: When they had done so, they caught such a large number of fish that their nets began to break.

verses.name: Luke 5:7
verses.text: So they signaled their partners in the other boat to come and help them, and they came and filled both boats so full that they began to sink.

verses.name: Luke 5:8
verses.text: When Simon Peter saw this, he fell at Jesus' knees and said, "Go away from me, Lord; I am a sinful man!"

verses.name: Luke 5:9
verses.text: For he and all his companions were astonished at the catch of fish they had taken,

verses.name: Luke 5:10
verses.text: and so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, Simon's partners.

verses.name: Luke 5:11
verses.text: Then Jesus said to Simon, "Don't be afraid; from now on you will catch men." So they pulled their boats up on shore, left everything and followed him.

verses.name: Luke 5:12
verses.text: While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came along who was covered with leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell with his face to the ground and begged him, "Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean."

verses.name: Luke 5:13
verses.text: Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. "I am willing," he said. "Be clean!" And immediately the leprosy left him.

verses.name: Luke 5:14
verses.text: Then Jesus ordered him, "Don't tell anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them."

verses.name: Luke 5:15
verses.text: Yet the news about him spread all the more, so that crowds of people came to hear him and to be healed of their sicknesses.

verses.name: Luke 5:16
verses.text: But Jesus often withdrew to lonely places and prayed.

verses.name: Luke 5:17
verses.text: One day as he was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law, who had come from every village of Galilee and from Judea and Jerusalem, were sitting there. And the power of the Lord was present for him to heal the sick.

verses.name: Luke 5:18
verses.text: Some men came carrying a paralytic on a mat and tried to take him into the house to lay him before Jesus.

verses.name: Luke 5:19
verses.text: When they could not find a way to do this because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and lowered him on his mat through the tiles into the middle of the crowd, right in front of Jesus.

verses.name: Luke 5:20
verses.text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said, "Friend, your sins are forgiven."

verses.name: Luke 5:21
verses.text: The Pharisees and the teachers of the law began thinking to themselves, "Who is this fellow who speaks blasphemy? Who can forgive sins but God alone?"

verses.name: Luke 5:22
verses.text: Jesus knew what they were thinking and asked, "Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?

verses.name: Luke 5:23
verses.text: Which is easier: to say, 'Your sins are forgiven,' or to say, 'Get up and walk'?

verses.name: Luke 5:24
verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins...." He said to the paralyzed man, "I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home."

verses.name: Luke 5:25
verses.text: Immediately he stood up in front of them, took what he had been lying on and went home praising God.

verses.name: Luke 5:26
verses.text: Everyone was amazed and gave praise to God. They were filled with awe and said, "We have seen remarkable things today."

verses.name: Luke 5:27
verses.text: After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector by the name of Levi sitting at his tax booth. "Follow me," Jesus said to him,

verses.name: Luke 5:28
verses.text: and Levi got up, left everything and followed him.

verses.name: Luke 5:29
verses.text: Then Levi held a great banquet for Jesus at his house, and a large crowd of tax collectors and others were eating with them.

verses.name: Luke 5:30
verses.text: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law who belonged to their sect complained to his disciples, "Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and 'sinners'?"

verses.name: Luke 5:31
verses.text: Jesus answered them, "It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick.

verses.name: Luke 5:32
verses.text: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance."

verses.name: Luke 5:33
verses.text: They said to him, "John's disciples often fast and pray, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours go on eating and drinking."

verses.name: Luke 5:34
verses.text: Jesus answered, "Can you make the guests of the bridegroom fast while he is with them?

verses.name: Luke 5:35
verses.text: But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them; in those days they will fast."

verses.name: Luke 5:36
verses.text: He told them this parable: "No one tears a patch from a new garment and sews it on an old one. If he does, he will have torn the new garment, and the patch from the new will not match the old.

verses.name: Luke 5:37
verses.text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the new wine will burst the skins, the wine will run out and the wineskins will be ruined.

verses.name: Luke 5:38
verses.text: No, new wine must be poured into new wineskins.

verses.name: Luke 5:39
verses.text: And no one after drinking old wine wants the new, for he says, 'The old is better.'"

verses.name: Luke 6:1
verses.text: One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and his disciples began to pick some heads of grain, rub them in their hands and eat the kernels.

verses.name: Luke 6:2
verses.text: Some of the Pharisees asked, "Why are you doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?"

verses.name: Luke 6:3
verses.text: Jesus answered them, "Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?

verses.name: Luke 6:4
verses.text: He entered the house of God, and taking the consecrated bread, he ate what is lawful only for priests to eat. And he also gave some to his companions."

verses.name: Luke 6:5
verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, "The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath."

verses.name: Luke 6:6
verses.text: On another Sabbath he went into the synagogue and was teaching, and a man was there whose right hand was shriveled.

verses.name: Luke 6:7
verses.text: The Pharisees and the teachers of the law were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they watched him closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath.

verses.name: Luke 6:8
verses.text: But Jesus knew what they were thinking and said to the man with the shriveled hand, "Get up and stand in front of everyone." So he got up and stood there.

verses.name: Luke 6:9
verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, "I ask you, which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy it?"

verses.name: Luke 6:10
verses.text: He looked around at them all, and then said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." He did so, and his hand was completely restored.

verses.name: Luke 6:11
verses.text: But they were furious and began to discuss with one another what they might do to Jesus.

verses.name: Luke 6:12
verses.text: One of those days Jesus went out to a mountainside to pray, and spent the night praying to God.

verses.name: Luke 6:13
verses.text: When morning came, he called his disciples to him and chose twelve of them, whom he also designated apostles:

verses.name: Luke 6:14
verses.text: Simon (whom he named Peter), his brother Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,

verses.name: Luke 6:15
verses.text: Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zealot,

verses.name: Luke 6:16
verses.text: Judas son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.

verses.name: Luke 6:17
verses.text: He went down with them and stood on a level place. A large crowd of his disciples was there and a great number of people from all over Judea, from Jerusalem, and from the coast of Tyre and Sidon,

verses.name: Luke 6:18
verses.text: who had come to hear him and to be healed of their diseases. Those troubled by evil spirits were cured,

verses.name: Luke 6:19
verses.text: and the people all tried to touch him, because power was coming from him and healing them all.

verses.name: Luke 6:20
verses.text: Looking at his disciples, he said: "Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Luke 6:21
verses.text: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be satisfied. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.

verses.name: Luke 6:22
verses.text: Blessed are you when men hate you, when they exclude you and insult you and reject your name as evil, because of the Son of Man.

verses.name: Luke 6:23
verses.text: "Rejoice in that day and leap for joy, because great is your reward in heaven. For that is how their fathers treated the prophets.

verses.name: Luke 6:24
verses.text: "But woe to you who are rich, for you have already received your comfort.

verses.name: Luke 6:25
verses.text: Woe to you who are well fed now, for you will go hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.

verses.name: Luke 6:26
verses.text: Woe to you when all men speak well of you, for that is how their fathers treated the false prophets.

verses.name: Luke 6:27
verses.text: "But I tell you who hear me: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,

verses.name: Luke 6:28
verses.text: bless those who curse you, pray for those who mistreat you.

verses.name: Luke 6:29
verses.text: If someone strikes you on one cheek, turn to him the other also. If someone takes your cloak, do not stop him from taking your tunic.

verses.name: Luke 6:30
verses.text: Give to everyone who asks you, and if anyone takes what belongs to you, do not demand it back.

verses.name: Luke 6:31
verses.text: Do to others as you would have them do to you.

verses.name: Luke 6:32
verses.text: "If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? Even 'sinners' love those who love them.

verses.name: Luke 6:33
verses.text: And if you do good to those who are good to you, what credit is that to you? Even 'sinners' do that.

verses.name: Luke 6:34
verses.text: And if you lend to those from whom you expect repayment, what credit is that to you? Even 'sinners' lend to 'sinners,' expecting to be repaid in full.

verses.name: Luke 6:35
verses.text: But love your enemies, do good to them, and lend to them without expecting to get anything back. Then your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, because he is kind to the ungrateful and wicked.

verses.name: Luke 6:36
verses.text: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.

verses.name: Luke 6:37
verses.text: "Do not judge, and you will not be judged. Do not condemn, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

verses.name: Luke 6:38
verses.text: Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you."

verses.name: Luke 6:39
verses.text: He also told them this parable: "Can a blind man lead a blind man? Will they not both fall into a pit?

verses.name: Luke 6:40
verses.text: A student is not above his teacher, but everyone who is fully trained will be like his teacher.

verses.name: Luke 6:41
verses.text: "Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother's eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye?

verses.name: Luke 6:42
verses.text: How can you say to your brother, 'Brother, let me take the speck out of your eye,' when you yourself fail to see the plank in your own eye? You hypocrite, first take the plank out of your eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.

verses.name: Luke 6:43
verses.text: "No good tree bears bad fruit, nor does a bad tree bear good fruit.

verses.name: Luke 6:44
verses.text: Each tree is recognized by its own fruit. People do not pick figs from thornbushes, or grapes from briers.

verses.name: Luke 6:45
verses.text: The good man brings good things out of the good stored up in his heart, and the evil man brings evil things out of the evil stored up in his heart. For out of the overflow of his heart his mouth speaks.

verses.name: Luke 6:46
verses.text: "Why do you call me, 'Lord, Lord,' and do not do what I say?

verses.name: Luke 6:47
verses.text: I will show you what he is like who comes to me and hears my words and puts them into practice.

verses.name: Luke 6:48
verses.text: He is like a man building a house, who dug down deep and laid the foundation on rock. When a flood came, the torrent struck that house but could not shake it, because it was well built.

verses.name: Luke 6:49
verses.text: But the one who hears my words and does not put them into practice is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. The moment the torrent struck that house, it collapsed and its destruction was complete."

verses.name: Luke 7:1
verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying all this in the hearing of the people, he entered Capernaum.

verses.name: Luke 7:2
verses.text: There a centurion's servant, whom his master valued highly, was sick and about to die.

verses.name: Luke 7:3
verses.text: The centurion heard of Jesus and sent some elders of the Jews to him, asking him to come and heal his servant.

verses.name: Luke 7:4
verses.text: When they came to Jesus, they pleaded earnestly with him, "This man deserves to have you do this,

verses.name: Luke 7:5
verses.text: because he loves our nation and has built our synagogue."

verses.name: Luke 7:6
verses.text: So Jesus went with them. He was not far from the house when the centurion sent friends to say to him: "Lord, don't trouble yourself, for I do not deserve to have you come under my roof.

verses.name: Luke 7:7
verses.text: That is why I did not even consider myself worthy to come to you. But say the word, and my servant will be healed.

verses.name: Luke 7:8
verses.text: For I myself am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I tell this one, 'Go,' and he goes; and that one, 'Come,' and he comes. I say to my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it."

verses.name: Luke 7:9
verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed at him, and turning to the crowd following him, he said, "I tell you, I have not found such great faith even in Israel."

verses.name: Luke 7:10
verses.text: Then the men who had been sent returned to the house and found the servant well.

verses.name: Luke 7:11
verses.text: Soon afterward, Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd went along with him.

verses.name: Luke 7:12
verses.text: As he approached the town gate, a dead person was being carried out--the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. And a large crowd from the town was with her.

verses.name: Luke 7:13
verses.text: When the Lord saw her, his heart went out to her and he said, "Don't cry."

verses.name: Luke 7:14
verses.text: Then he went up and touched the coffin, and those carrying it stood still. He said, "Young man, I say to you, get up!"

verses.name: Luke 7:15
verses.text: The dead man sat up and began to talk, and Jesus gave him back to his mother.

verses.name: Luke 7:16
verses.text: They were all filled with awe and praised God. "A great prophet has appeared among us," they said. "God has come to help his people."

verses.name: Luke 7:17
verses.text: This news about Jesus spread throughout Judea and the surrounding country.

verses.name: Luke 7:18
verses.text: John's disciples told him about all these things. Calling two of them,

verses.name: Luke 7:19
verses.text: he sent them to the Lord to ask, "Are you the one who was to come, or should we expect someone else?"

verses.name: Luke 7:20
verses.text: When the men came to Jesus, they said, "John the Baptist sent us to you to ask, 'Are you the one who was to come, or should we expect someone else?'"

verses.name: Luke 7:21
verses.text: At that very time Jesus cured many who had diseases, sicknesses and evil spirits, and gave sight to many who were blind.

verses.name: Luke 7:22
verses.text: So he replied to the messengers, "Go back and report to John what you have seen and heard: The blind receive sight, the lame walk, those who have leprosy are cured, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the good news is preached to the poor.

verses.name: Luke 7:23
verses.text: Blessed is the man who does not fall away on account of me."

verses.name: Luke 7:24
verses.text: After John's messengers left, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John: "What did you go out into the desert to see? A reed swayed by the wind?

verses.name: Luke 7:25
verses.text: If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No, those who wear expensive clothes and indulge in luxury are in palaces.

verses.name: Luke 7:26
verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.

verses.name: Luke 7:27
verses.text: This is the one about whom it is written: "'I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.'

verses.name: Luke 7:28
verses.text: I tell you, among those born of women there is no one greater than John; yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he."

verses.name: Luke 7:29
verses.text: (All the people, even the tax collectors, when they heard Jesus' words, acknowledged that God's way was right, because they had been baptized by John.

verses.name: Luke 7:30
verses.text: But the Pharisees and experts in the law rejected God's purpose for themselves, because they had not been baptized by John.)

verses.name: Luke 7:31
verses.text: "To what, then, can I compare the people of this generation? What are they like?

verses.name: Luke 7:32
verses.text: They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling out to each other: "'We played the flute for you, and you did not dance; we sang a dirge, and you did not cry.'

verses.name: Luke 7:33
verses.text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, 'He has a demon.'

verses.name: Luke 7:34
verses.text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and you say, 'Here is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and "sinners."'

verses.name: Luke 7:35
verses.text: But wisdom is proved right by all her children."

verses.name: Luke 7:36
verses.text: Now one of the Pharisees invited Jesus to have dinner with him, so he went to the Pharisee's house and reclined at the table.

verses.name: Luke 7:37
verses.text: When a woman who had lived a sinful life in that town learned that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee's house, she brought an alabaster jar of perfume,

verses.name: Luke 7:38
verses.text: and as she stood behind him at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears. Then she wiped them with her hair, kissed them and poured perfume on them.

verses.name: Luke 7:39
verses.text: When the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he said to himself, "If this man were a prophet, he would know who is touching him and what kind of woman she is--that she is a sinner."

verses.name: Luke 7:40
verses.text: Jesus answered him, "Simon, I have something to tell you.Tell me, teacher," he said.

verses.name: Luke 7:41
verses.text: "Two men owed money to a certain moneylender. One owed him five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

verses.name: Luke 7:42
verses.text: Neither of them had the money to pay him back, so he canceled the debts of both. Now which of them will love him more?"

verses.name: Luke 7:43
verses.text: Simon replied, "I suppose the one who had the bigger debt canceled.You have judged correctly," Jesus said.

verses.name: Luke 7:44
verses.text: Then he turned toward the woman and said to Simon, "Do you see this woman? I came into your house. You did not give me any water for my feet, but she wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.

verses.name: Luke 7:45
verses.text: You did not give me a kiss, but this woman, from the time I entered, has not stopped kissing my feet.

verses.name: Luke 7:46
verses.text: You did not put oil on my head, but she has poured perfume on my feet.

verses.name: Luke 7:47
verses.text: Therefore, I tell you, her many sins have been forgiven--for she loved much. But he who has been forgiven little loves little."

verses.name: Luke 7:48
verses.text: Then Jesus said to her, "Your sins are forgiven."

verses.name: Luke 7:49
verses.text: The other guests began to say among themselves, "Who is this who even forgives sins?"

verses.name: Luke 7:50
verses.text: Jesus said to the woman, "Your faith has saved you; go in peace."

verses.name: Luke 8:1
verses.text: After this, Jesus traveled about from one town and village to another, proclaiming the good news of the kingdom of God. The Twelve were with him,

verses.name: Luke 8:2
verses.text: and also some women who had been cured of evil spirits and diseases: Mary (called Magdalene) from whom seven demons had come out;

verses.name: Luke 8:3
verses.text: Joanna the wife of Cuza, the manager of Herod's household; Susanna; and many others. These women were helping to support them out of their own means.

verses.name: Luke 8:4
verses.text: While a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from town after town, he told this parable:

verses.name: Luke 8:5
verses.text: "A farmer went out to sow his seed. As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path; it was trampled on, and the birds of the air ate it up.

verses.name: Luke 8:6
verses.text: Some fell on rock, and when it came up, the plants withered because they had no moisture.

verses.name: Luke 8:7
verses.text: Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up with it and choked the plants.

verses.name: Luke 8:8
verses.text: Still other seed fell on good soil. It came up and yielded a crop, a hundred times more than was sown." When he said this, he called out, "He who has ears to hear, let him hear."

verses.name: Luke 8:9
verses.text: His disciples asked him what this parable meant.

verses.name: Luke 8:10
verses.text: He said, "The knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of God has been given to you, but to others I speak in parables, so that, "'though seeing, they may not see; though hearing, they may not understand.'

verses.name: Luke 8:11
verses.text: "This is the meaning of the parable: The seed is the word of God.

verses.name: Luke 8:12
verses.text: Those along the path are the ones who hear, and then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts, so that they may not believe and be saved.

verses.name: Luke 8:13
verses.text: Those on the rock are the ones who receive the word with joy when they hear it, but they have no root. They believe for a while, but in the time of testing they fall away.

verses.name: Luke 8:14
verses.text: The seed that fell among thorns stands for those who hear, but as they go on their way they are choked by life's worries, riches and pleasures, and they do not mature.

verses.name: Luke 8:15
verses.text: But the seed on good soil stands for those with a noble and good heart, who hear the word, retain it, and by persevering produce a crop.

verses.name: Luke 8:16
verses.text: "No one lights a lamp and hides it in a jar or puts it under a bed. Instead, he puts it on a stand, so that those who come in can see the light.

verses.name: Luke 8:17
verses.text: For there is nothing hidden that will not be disclosed, and nothing concealed that will not be known or brought out into the open.

verses.name: Luke 8:18
verses.text: Therefore consider carefully how you listen. Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what he thinks he has will be taken from him."

verses.name: Luke 8:19
verses.text: Now Jesus' mother and brothers came to see him, but they were not able to get near him because of the crowd.

verses.name: Luke 8:20
verses.text: Someone told him, "Your mother and brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you."

verses.name: Luke 8:21
verses.text: He replied, "My mother and brothers are those who hear God's word and put it into practice."

verses.name: Luke 8:22
verses.text: One day Jesus said to his disciples, "Let's go over to the other side of the lake." So they got into a boat and set out.

verses.name: Luke 8:23
verses.text: As they sailed, he fell asleep. A squall came down on the lake, so that the boat was being swamped, and they were in great danger.

verses.name: Luke 8:24
verses.text: The disciples went and woke him, saying, "Master, Master, we're going to drown!"

verses.name: Luke 8:25
verses.text: He got up and rebuked the wind and the raging waters; the storm subsided, and all was calm. "Where is your faith?" he asked his disciples. In fear and amazement they asked one another, "Who is this? He commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him."

verses.name: Luke 8:26
verses.text: They sailed to the region of the Gerasenes, which is across the lake from Galilee.

verses.name: Luke 8:27
verses.text: When Jesus stepped ashore, he was met by a demon-possessed man from the town. For a long time this man had not worn clothes or lived in a house, but had lived in the tombs.

verses.name: Luke 8:28
verses.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell at his feet, shouting at the top of his voice, "What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don't torture me!"

verses.name: Luke 8:29
verses.text: For Jesus had commanded the evil spirit to come out of the man. Many times it had seized him, and though he was chained hand and foot and kept under guard, he had broken his chains and had been driven by the demon into solitary places.

verses.name: Luke 8:30
verses.text: Jesus asked him, "What is your name?"

verses.name: Luke 8:31
verses.text: "Legion," he replied, because many demons had gone into him. And they begged him repeatedly not to order them to go into the Abyss.

verses.name: Luke 8:32
verses.text: A large herd of pigs was feeding there on the hillside. The demons begged Jesus to let them go into them, and he gave them permission.

verses.name: Luke 8:33
verses.text: When the demons came out of the man, they went into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned.

verses.name: Luke 8:34
verses.text: When those tending the pigs saw what had happened, they ran off and reported this in the town and countryside,

verses.name: Luke 8:35
verses.text: and the people went out to see what had happened. When they came to Jesus, they found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus' feet, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

verses.name: Luke 8:36
verses.text: Those who had seen it told the people how the demon-possessed man had been cured.

verses.name: Luke 8:37
verses.text: Then all the people of the region of the Gerasenes asked Jesus to leave them, because they were overcome with fear. So he got into the boat and left.

verses.name: Luke 8:38
verses.text: The man from whom the demons had gone out begged to go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

verses.name: Luke 8:39
verses.text: "Return home and tell how much God has done for you." So the man went away and told all over town how much Jesus had done for him.

verses.name: Luke 8:40
verses.text: Now when Jesus returned, a crowd welcomed him, for they were all expecting him.

verses.name: Luke 8:41
verses.text: Then a man named Jairus, a ruler of the synagogue, came and fell at Jesus' feet, pleading with him to come to his house

verses.name: Luke 8:42
verses.text: because his only daughter, a girl of about twelve, was dying.

verses.name: Luke 8:43
verses.text: As Jesus was on his way, the crowds almost crushed him. And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years, but no one could heal her.

verses.name: Luke 8:44
verses.text: She came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak, and immediately her bleeding stopped.

verses.name: Luke 8:45
verses.text: "Who touched me?" Jesus asked. When they all denied it, Peter said, "Master, the people are crowding and pressing against you."

verses.name: Luke 8:46
verses.text: But Jesus said, "Someone touched me; I know that power has gone out from me."

verses.name: Luke 8:47
verses.text: Then the woman, seeing that she could not go unnoticed, came trembling and fell at his feet. In the presence of all the people, she told why she had touched him and how she had been instantly healed.

verses.name: Luke 8:48
verses.text: Then he said to her, "Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace."

verses.name: Luke 8:49
verses.text: While Jesus was still speaking, someone came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue ruler. "Your daughter is dead," he said. "Don't bother the teacher any more."

verses.name: Luke 8:50
verses.text: Hearing this, Jesus said to Jairus, "Don't be afraid; just believe, and she will be healed."

verses.name: Luke 8:51
verses.text: When he arrived at the house of Jairus, he did not let anyone go in with him except Peter, John and James, and the child's father and mother.

verses.name: Luke 8:52
verses.text: Meanwhile, all the people were wailing and mourning for her. "Stop wailing," Jesus said. "She is not dead but asleep."

verses.name: Luke 8:53
verses.text: They laughed at him, knowing that she was dead.

verses.name: Luke 8:54
verses.text: But he took her by the hand and said, "My child, get up!"

verses.name: Luke 8:55
verses.text: Her spirit returned, and at once she stood up. Then Jesus told them to give her something to eat.

verses.name: Luke 8:56
verses.text: Her parents were astonished, but he ordered them not to tell anyone what had happened.

verses.name: Luke 9:1
verses.text: When Jesus had called the Twelve together, he gave them power and authority to drive out all demons and to cure diseases,

verses.name: Luke 9:2
verses.text: and he sent them out to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.

verses.name: Luke 9:3
verses.text: He told them: "Take nothing for the journey--no staff, no bag, no bread, no money, no extra tunic.

verses.name: Luke 9:4
verses.text: Whatever house you enter, stay there until you leave that town.

verses.name: Luke 9:5
verses.text: If people do not welcome you, shake the dust off your feet when you leave their town, as a testimony against them."

verses.name: Luke 9:6
verses.text: So they set out and went from village to village, preaching the gospel and healing people everywhere.

verses.name: Luke 9:7
verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard about all that was going on. And he was perplexed, because some were saying that John had been raised from the dead,

verses.name: Luke 9:8
verses.text: others that Elijah had appeared, and still others that one of the prophets of long ago had come back to life.

verses.name: Luke 9:9
verses.text: But Herod said, "I beheaded John. Who, then, is this I hear such things about?" And he tried to see him.

verses.name: Luke 9:10
verses.text: When the apostles returned, they reported to Jesus what they had done. Then he took them with him and they withdrew by themselves to a town called Bethsaida,

verses.name: Luke 9:11
verses.text: but the crowds learned about it and followed him. He welcomed them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who needed healing.

verses.name: Luke 9:12
verses.text: Late in the afternoon the Twelve came to him and said, "Send the crowd away so they can go to the surrounding villages and countryside and find food and lodging, because we are in a remote place here."

verses.name: Luke 9:13
verses.text: He replied, "You give them something to eat."

verses.name: Luke 9:14
verses.text: They answered, "We have only five loaves of bread and two fish--unless we go and buy food for all this crowd." (About five thousand men were there.)

verses.name: Luke 9:15
verses.text: But he said to his disciples, "Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each." The disciples did so, and everybody sat down.

verses.name: Luke 9:16
verses.text: Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke them. Then he gave them to the disciples to set before the people.

verses.name: Luke 9:17
verses.text: They all ate and were satisfied, and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

verses.name: Luke 9:18
verses.text: Once when Jesus was praying in private and his disciples were with him, he asked them, "Who do the crowds say I am?"

verses.name: Luke 9:19
verses.text: They replied, "Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, that one of the prophets of long ago has come back to life."

verses.name: Luke 9:20
verses.text: "But what about you?" he asked. "Who do you say I am?" Peter answered, "The Christ of God."

verses.name: Luke 9:21
verses.text: Jesus strictly warned them not to tell this to anyone.

verses.name: Luke 9:22
verses.text: And he said, "The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests and teachers of the law, and he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life."

verses.name: Luke 9:23
verses.text: Then he said to them all: "If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me.

verses.name: Luke 9:24
verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for me will save it.

verses.name: Luke 9:25
verses.text: What good is it for a man to gain the whole world, and yet lose or forfeit his very self?

verses.name: Luke 9:26
verses.text: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when he comes in his glory and in the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.

verses.name: Luke 9:27
verses.text: I tell you the truth, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the kingdom of God."

verses.name: Luke 9:28
verses.text: About eight days after Jesus said this, he took Peter, John and James with him and went up onto a mountain to pray.

verses.name: Luke 9:29
verses.text: As he was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothes became as bright as a flash of lightning.

verses.name: Luke 9:30
verses.text: Two men, Moses and Elijah,

verses.name: Luke 9:31
verses.text: appeared in glorious splendor, talking with Jesus. They spoke about his departure, which he was about to bring to fulfillment at Jerusalem.

verses.name: Luke 9:32
verses.text: Peter and his companions were very sleepy, but when they became fully awake, they saw his glory and the two men standing with him.

verses.name: Luke 9:33
verses.text: As the men were leaving Jesus, Peter said to him, "Master, it is good for us to be here. Let us put up three shelters--one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah." (He did not know what he was saying.)

verses.name: Luke 9:34
verses.text: While he was speaking, a cloud appeared and enveloped them, and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.

verses.name: Luke 9:35
verses.text: A voice came from the cloud, saying, "This is my Son, whom I have chosen; listen to him."

verses.name: Luke 9:36
verses.text: When the voice had spoken, they found that Jesus was alone. The disciples kept this to themselves, and told no one at that time what they had seen.

verses.name: Luke 9:37
verses.text: The next day, when they came down from the mountain, a large crowd met him.

verses.name: Luke 9:38
verses.text: A man in the crowd called out, "Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.

verses.name: Luke 9:39
verses.text: A spirit seizes him and he suddenly screams; it throws him into convulsions so that he foams at the mouth. It scarcely ever leaves him and is destroying him.

verses.name: Luke 9:40
verses.text: I begged your disciples to drive it out, but they could not."

verses.name: Luke 9:41
verses.text: "O unbelieving and perverse generation," Jesus replied, "how long shall I stay with you and put up with you? Bring your son here."

verses.name: Luke 9:42
verses.text: Even while the boy was coming, the demon threw him to the ground in a convulsion. But Jesus rebuked the evil spirit, healed the boy and gave him back to his father.

verses.name: Luke 9:43
verses.text: And they were all amazed at the greatness of God.

verses.name: Luke 9:44
verses.text: While everyone was marveling at all that Jesus did, he said to his disciples, "Listen carefully to what I am about to tell you: The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men."

verses.name: Luke 9:45
verses.text: But they did not understand what this meant. It was hidden from them, so that they did not grasp it, and they were afraid to ask him about it.

verses.name: Luke 9:46
verses.text: An argument started among the disciples as to which of them would be the greatest.

verses.name: Luke 9:47
verses.text: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, took a little child and had him stand beside him.

verses.name: Luke 9:48
verses.text: Then he said to them, "Whoever welcomes this little child in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me. For he who is least among you all--he is the greatest."

verses.name: Luke 9:49
verses.text: "Master," said John, "we saw a man driving out demons in your name and we tried to stop him, because he is not one of us."

verses.name: Luke 9:50
verses.text: "Do not stop him," Jesus said, "for whoever is not against you is for you."

verses.name: Luke 9:51
verses.text: As the time approached for him to be taken up to heaven, Jesus resolutely set out for Jerusalem.

verses.name: Luke 9:52
verses.text: And he sent messengers on ahead, who went into a Samaritan village to get things ready for him;

verses.name: Luke 9:53
verses.text: but the people there did not welcome him, because he was heading for Jerusalem.

verses.name: Luke 9:54
verses.text: When the disciples James and John saw this, they asked, "Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven to destroy them?"

verses.name: Luke 9:55
verses.text: But Jesus turned and rebuked them,

verses.name: Luke 9:56
verses.text: and they went to another village.

verses.name: Luke 9:57
verses.text: As they were walking along the road, a man said to him, "I will follow you wherever you go."

verses.name: Luke 9:58
verses.text: Jesus replied, "Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head."

verses.name: Luke 9:59
verses.text: He said to another man, "Follow me." But the man replied, "Lord, first let me go and bury my father."

verses.name: Luke 9:60
verses.text: Jesus said to him, "Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and proclaim the kingdom of God."

verses.name: Luke 9:61
verses.text: Still another said, "I will follow you, Lord; but first let me go back and say good bye to my family."

verses.name: Luke 9:62
verses.text: Jesus replied, "No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for service in the kingdom of God."

verses.name: Luke 10:1
verses.text: After this the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them two by two ahead of him to every town and place where he was about to go.

verses.name: Luke 10:2
verses.text: He told them, "The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

verses.name: Luke 10:3
verses.text: Go! I am sending you out like lambs among wolves.

verses.name: Luke 10:4
verses.text: Do not take a purse or bag or sandals; and do not greet anyone on the road.

verses.name: Luke 10:5
verses.text: "When you enter a house, first say, 'Peace to this house.'

verses.name: Luke 10:6
verses.text: If a man of peace is there, your peace will rest on him; if not, it will return to you.

verses.name: Luke 10:7
verses.text: Stay in that house, eating and drinking whatever they give you, for the worker deserves his wages. Do not move around from house to house.

verses.name: Luke 10:8
verses.text: "When you enter a town and are welcomed, eat what is set before you.

verses.name: Luke 10:9
verses.text: Heal the sick who are there and tell them, 'The kingdom of God is near you.'

verses.name: Luke 10:10
verses.text: But when you enter a town and are not welcomed, go into its streets and say,

verses.name: Luke 10:11
verses.text: 'Even the dust of your town that sticks to our feet we wipe off against you. Yet be sure of this: The kingdom of God is near.'

verses.name: Luke 10:12
verses.text: I tell you, it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that town.

verses.name: Luke 10:13
verses.text: "Woe to you, Korazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

verses.name: Luke 10:14
verses.text: But it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.

verses.name: Luke 10:15
verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted up to the skies? No, you will go down to the depths.

verses.name: Luke 10:16
verses.text: "He who listens to you listens to me; he who rejects you rejects me; but he who rejects me rejects him who sent me."

verses.name: Luke 10:17
verses.text: The seventy-two returned with joy and said, "Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name."

verses.name: Luke 10:18
verses.text: He replied, "I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.

verses.name: Luke 10:19
verses.text: I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy; nothing will harm you.

verses.name: Luke 10:20
verses.text: However, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven."

verses.name: Luke 10:21
verses.text: At that time Jesus, full of joy through the Holy Spirit, said, "I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and learned, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for this was your good pleasure.

verses.name: Luke 10:22
verses.text: "All things have been committed to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, and no one knows who the Father is except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him."

verses.name: Luke 10:23
verses.text: Then he turned to his disciples and said privately, "Blessed are the eyes that see what you see.

verses.name: Luke 10:24
verses.text: For I tell you that many prophets and kings wanted to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it."

verses.name: Luke 10:25
verses.text: On one occasion an expert in the law stood up to test Jesus. "Teacher," he asked, "what must I do to inherit eternal life?"

verses.name: Luke 10:26
verses.text: "What is written in the Law?" he replied. "How do you read it?"

verses.name: Luke 10:27
verses.text: He answered: "'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind'; and, 'Love your neighbor as yourself.'"

verses.name: Luke 10:28
verses.text: "You have answered correctly," Jesus replied. "Do this and you will live."

verses.name: Luke 10:29
verses.text: But he wanted to justify himself, so he asked Jesus, "And who is my neighbor?"

verses.name: Luke 10:30
verses.text: In reply Jesus said: "A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, when he fell into the hands of robbers. They stripped him of his clothes, beat him and went away, leaving him half dead.

verses.name: Luke 10:31
verses.text: A priest happened to be going down the same road, and when he saw the man, he passed by on the other side.

verses.name: Luke 10:32
verses.text: So too, a Levite, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.

verses.name: Luke 10:33
verses.text: But a Samaritan, as he traveled, came where the man was; and when he saw him, he took pity on him.

verses.name: Luke 10:34
verses.text: He went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. Then he put the man on his own donkey, took him to an inn and took care of him.

verses.name: Luke 10:35
verses.text: The next day he took out two silver coins and gave them to the innkeeper. 'Look after him,' he said, 'and when I return, I will reimburse you for any extra expense you may have.'

verses.name: Luke 10:36
verses.text: "Which of these three do you think was a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of robbers?"

verses.name: Luke 10:37
verses.text: The expert in the law replied, "The one who had mercy on him." Jesus told him, "Go and do likewise."

verses.name: Luke 10:38
verses.text: As Jesus and his disciples were on their way, he came to a village where a woman named Martha opened her home to him.

verses.name: Luke 10:39
verses.text: She had a sister called Mary, who sat at the Lord's feet listening to what he said.

verses.name: Luke 10:40
verses.text: But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made. She came to him and asked, "Lord, don't you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself? Tell her to help me!"

verses.name: Luke 10:41
verses.text: "Martha, Martha," the Lord answered, "you are worried and upset about many things,

verses.name: Luke 10:42
verses.text: but only one thing is needed. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her."

verses.name: Luke 11:1
verses.text: One day Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples said to him, "Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples."

verses.name: Luke 11:2
verses.text: He said to them, "When you pray, say: "'Father, hallowed be your name, your kingdom come.

verses.name: Luke 11:3
verses.text: Give us each day our daily bread.

verses.name: Luke 11:4
verses.text: Forgive us our sins, for we also forgive everyone who sins against us. And lead us not into temptation. '"

verses.name: Luke 11:5
verses.text: Then he said to them, "Suppose one of you has a friend, and he goes to him at midnight and says, 'Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,

verses.name: Luke 11:6
verses.text: because a friend of mine on a journey has come to me, and I have nothing to set before him.'

verses.name: Luke 11:7
verses.text: "Then the one inside answers, 'Don't bother me. The door is already locked, and my children are with me in bed. I can't get up and give you anything.'

verses.name: Luke 11:8
verses.text: I tell you, though he will not get up and give him the bread because he is his friend, yet because of the man's boldness he will get up and give him as much as he needs.

verses.name: Luke 11:9
verses.text: "So I say to you: Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.

verses.name: Luke 11:10
verses.text: For everyone who asks receives; he who seeks finds; and to him who knocks, the door will be opened.

verses.name: Luke 11:11
verses.text: "Which of you fathers, if your son asks for a fish, will give him a snake instead?

verses.name: Luke 11:12
verses.text: Or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?

verses.name: Luke 11:13
verses.text: If you then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!"

verses.name: Luke 11:14
verses.text: Jesus was driving out a demon that was mute. When the demon left, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowd was amazed.

verses.name: Luke 11:15
verses.text: But some of them said, "By Beelzebub, the prince of demons, he is driving out demons."

verses.name: Luke 11:16
verses.text: Others tested him by asking for a sign from heaven.

verses.name: Luke 11:17
verses.text: Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them: "Any kingdom divided against itself will be ruined, and a house divided against itself will fall.

verses.name: Luke 11:18
verses.text: If Satan is divided against himself, how can his kingdom stand? I say this because you claim that I drive out demons by Beelzebub.

verses.name: Luke 11:19
verses.text: Now if I drive out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your followers drive them out? So then, they will be your judges.

verses.name: Luke 11:20
verses.text: But if I drive out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has come to you.

verses.name: Luke 11:21
verses.text: "When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own house, his possessions are safe.

verses.name: Luke 11:22
verses.text: But when someone stronger attacks and overpowers him, he takes away the armor in which the man trusted and divides up the spoils.

verses.name: Luke 11:23
verses.text: "He who is not with me is against me, and he who does not gather with me, scatters.

verses.name: Luke 11:24
verses.text: "When an evil spirit comes out of a man, it goes through arid places seeking rest and does not find it. Then it says, 'I will return to the house I left.'

verses.name: Luke 11:25
verses.text: When it arrives, it finds the house swept clean and put in order.

verses.name: Luke 11:26
verses.text: Then it goes and takes seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they go in and live there. And the final condition of that man is worse than the first."

verses.name: Luke 11:27
