verses.text: As Jesus was saying these things, a woman in the crowd called out, "Blessed is the mother who gave you birth and nursed you."

verses.name: Luke 11:28
verses.text: He replied, "Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it."

verses.name: Luke 11:29
verses.text: As the crowds increased, Jesus said, "This is a wicked generation. It asks for a miraculous sign, but none will be given it except the sign of Jonah.

verses.name: Luke 11:30
verses.text: For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so also will the Son of Man be to this generation.

verses.name: Luke 11:31
verses.text: The Queen of the South will rise at the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them; for she came from the ends of the earth to listen to Solomon's wisdom, and now one greater than Solomon is here.

verses.name: Luke 11:32
verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and now one greater than Jonah is here.

verses.name: Luke 11:33
verses.text: "No one lights a lamp and puts it in a place where it will be hidden, or under a bowl. Instead he puts it on its stand, so that those who come in may see the light.

verses.name: Luke 11:34
verses.text: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eyes are good, your whole body also is full of light. But when they are bad, your body also is full of darkness.

verses.name: Luke 11:35
verses.text: See to it, then, that the light within you is not darkness.

verses.name: Luke 11:36
verses.text: Therefore, if your whole body is full of light, and no part of it dark, it will be completely lighted, as when the light of a lamp shines on you."

verses.name: Luke 11:37
verses.text: When Jesus had finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to eat with him; so he went in and reclined at the table.

verses.name: Luke 11:38
verses.text: But the Pharisee, noticing that Jesus did not first wash before the meal, was surprised.

verses.name: Luke 11:39
verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, "Now then, you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.

verses.name: Luke 11:40
verses.text: You foolish people! Did not the one who made the outside make the inside also?

verses.name: Luke 11:41
verses.text: But give what is inside the dish to the poor, and everything will be clean for you.

verses.name: Luke 11:42
verses.text: "Woe to you Pharisees, because you give God a tenth of your mint, rue and all other kinds of garden herbs, but you neglect justice and the love of God. You should have practiced the latter without leaving the former undone.

verses.name: Luke 11:43
verses.text: "Woe to you Pharisees, because you love the most important seats in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces.

verses.name: Luke 11:44
verses.text: "Woe to you, because you are like unmarked graves, which men walk over without knowing it."

verses.name: Luke 11:45
verses.text: One of the experts in the law answered him, "Teacher, when you say these things, you insult us also."

verses.name: Luke 11:46
verses.text: Jesus replied, "And you experts in the law, woe to you, because you load people down with burdens they can hardly carry, and you yourselves will not lift one finger to help them.

verses.name: Luke 11:47
verses.text: "Woe to you, because you build tombs for the prophets, and it was your forefathers who killed them.

verses.name: Luke 11:48
verses.text: So you testify that you approve of what your forefathers did; they killed the prophets, and you build their tombs.

verses.name: Luke 11:49
verses.text: Because of this, God in his wisdom said, 'I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and others they will persecute.'

verses.name: Luke 11:50
verses.text: Therefore this generation will be held responsible for the blood of all the prophets that has been shed since the beginning of the world,

verses.name: Luke 11:51
verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, this generation will be held responsible for it all.

verses.name: Luke 11:52
verses.text: "Woe to you experts in the law, because you have taken away the key to knowledge. You yourselves have not entered, and you have hindered those who were entering."

verses.name: Luke 11:53
verses.text: When Jesus left there, the Pharisees and the teachers of the law began to oppose him fiercely and to besiege him with questions,

verses.name: Luke 11:54
verses.text: waiting to catch him in something he might say.

verses.name: Luke 12:1
verses.text: Meanwhile, when a crowd of many thousands had gathered, so that they were trampling on one another, Jesus began to speak first to his disciples, saying: "Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

verses.name: Luke 12:2
verses.text: There is nothing concealed that will not be disclosed, or hidden that will not be made known.

verses.name: Luke 12:3
verses.text: What you have said in the dark will be heard in the daylight, and what you have whispered in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed from the roofs.

verses.name: Luke 12:4
verses.text: "I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body and after that can do no more.

verses.name: Luke 12:5
verses.text: But I will show you whom you should fear: Fear him who, after the killing of the body, has power to throw you into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear him.

verses.name: Luke 12:6
verses.text: Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God.

verses.name: Luke 12:7
verses.text: Indeed, the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Don't be afraid; you are worth more than many sparrows.

verses.name: Luke 12:8
verses.text: "I tell you, whoever acknowledges me before men, the Son of Man will also acknowledge him before the angels of God.

verses.name: Luke 12:9
verses.text: But he who disowns me before men will be disowned before the angels of God.

verses.name: Luke 12:10
verses.text: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

verses.name: Luke 12:11
verses.text: "When you are brought before synagogues, rulers and authorities, do not worry about how you will defend yourselves or what you will say,

verses.name: Luke 12:12
verses.text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you at that time what you should say."

verses.name: Luke 12:13
verses.text: Someone in the crowd said to him, "Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me."

verses.name: Luke 12:14
verses.text: Jesus replied, "Man, who appointed me a judge or an arbiter between you?"

verses.name: Luke 12:15
verses.text: Then he said to them, "Watch out! Be on your guard against all kinds of greed; a man's life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions."

verses.name: Luke 12:16
verses.text: And he told them this parable: "The ground of a certain rich man produced a good crop.

verses.name: Luke 12:17
verses.text: He thought to himself, 'What shall I do? I have no place to store my crops.'

verses.name: Luke 12:18
verses.text: "Then he said, 'This is what I'll do. I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.

verses.name: Luke 12:19
verses.text: And I'll say to myself, "You have plenty of good things laid up for many years. Take life easy; eat, drink and be merry."'

verses.name: Luke 12:20
verses.text: "But God said to him, 'You fool! This very night your life will be demanded from you. Then who will get what you have prepared for yourself?'

verses.name: Luke 12:21
verses.text: "This is how it will be with anyone who stores up things for himself but is not rich toward God."

verses.name: Luke 12:22
verses.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples: "Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat; or about your body, what you will wear.

verses.name: Luke 12:23
verses.text: Life is more than food, and the body more than clothes.

verses.name: Luke 12:24
verses.text: Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap, they have no storeroom or barn; yet God feeds them. And how much more valuable you are than birds!

verses.name: Luke 12:25
verses.text: Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to his life?

verses.name: Luke 12:26
verses.text: Since you cannot do this very little thing, why do you worry about the rest?

verses.name: Luke 12:27
verses.text: "Consider how the lilies grow. They do not labor or spin. Yet I tell you, not even Solomon in all his splendor was dressed like one of these.

verses.name: Luke 12:28
verses.text: If that is how God clothes the grass of the field, which is here today, and tomorrow is thrown into the fire, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith!

verses.name: Luke 12:29
verses.text: And do not set your heart on what you will eat or drink; do not worry about it.

verses.name: Luke 12:30
verses.text: For the pagan world runs after all such things, and your Father knows that you need them.

verses.name: Luke 12:31
verses.text: But seek his kingdom, and these things will be given to you as well.

verses.name: Luke 12:32
verses.text: "Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom.

verses.name: Luke 12:33
verses.text: Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Provide purses for yourselves that will not wear out, a treasure in heaven that will not be exhausted, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys.

verses.name: Luke 12:34
verses.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

verses.name: Luke 12:35
verses.text: "Be dressed ready for service and keep your lamps burning,

verses.name: Luke 12:36
verses.text: like men waiting for their master to return from a wedding banquet, so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him.

verses.name: Luke 12:37
verses.text: It will be good for those servants whose master finds them watching when he comes. I tell you the truth, he will dress himself to serve, will have them recline at the table and will come and wait on them.

verses.name: Luke 12:38
verses.text: It will be good for those servants whose master finds them ready, even if he comes in the second or third watch of the night.

verses.name: Luke 12:39
verses.text: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have let his house be broken into.

verses.name: Luke 12:40
verses.text: You also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him."

verses.name: Luke 12:41
verses.text: Peter asked, "Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everyone?"

verses.name: Luke 12:42
verses.text: The Lord answered, "Who then is the faithful and wise manager, whom the master puts in charge of his servants to give them their food allowance at the proper time?

verses.name: Luke 12:43
verses.text: It will be good for that servant whom the master finds doing so when he returns.

verses.name: Luke 12:44
verses.text: I tell you the truth, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.

verses.name: Luke 12:45
verses.text: But suppose the servant says to himself, 'My master is taking a long time in coming,' and he then begins to beat the menservants and maidservants and to eat and drink and get drunk.

verses.name: Luke 12:46
verses.text: The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of. He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the unbelievers.

verses.name: Luke 12:47
verses.text: "That servant who knows his master's will and does not get ready or does not do what his master wants will be beaten with many blows.

verses.name: Luke 12:48
verses.text: But the one who does not know and does things deserving punishment will be beaten with few blows. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded; and from the one who has been entrusted with much, much more will be asked.

verses.name: Luke 12:49
verses.text: "I have come to bring fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already kindled!

verses.name: Luke 12:50
verses.text: But I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it is completed!

verses.name: Luke 12:51
verses.text: Do you think I came to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, but division.

verses.name: Luke 12:52
verses.text: From now on there will be five in one family divided against each other, three against two and two against three.

verses.name: Luke 12:53
verses.text: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law."

verses.name: Luke 12:54
verses.text: He said to the crowd: "When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say, 'It's going to rain,' and it does.

verses.name: Luke 12:55
verses.text: And when the south wind blows, you say, 'It's going to be hot,' and it is.

verses.name: Luke 12:56
verses.text: Hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky. How is it that you don't know how to interpret this present time?

verses.name: Luke 12:57
verses.text: "Why don't you judge for yourselves what is right?

verses.name: Luke 12:58
verses.text: As you are going with your adversary to the magistrate, try hard to be reconciled to him on the way, or he may drag you off to the judge, and the judge turn you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.

verses.name: Luke 12:59
verses.text: I tell you, you will not get out until you have paid the last penny. "

verses.name: Luke 13:1
verses.text: Now there were some present at that time who told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.

verses.name: Luke 13:2
verses.text: Jesus answered, "Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans because they suffered this way?

verses.name: Luke 13:3
verses.text: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish.

verses.name: Luke 13:4
verses.text: Or those eighteen who died when the tower in Siloam fell on them--do you think they were more guilty than all the others living in Jerusalem?

verses.name: Luke 13:5
verses.text: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish."

verses.name: Luke 13:6
verses.text: Then he told this parable: "A man had a fig tree, planted in his vineyard, and he went to look for fruit on it, but did not find any.

verses.name: Luke 13:7
verses.text: So he said to the man who took care of the vineyard, 'For three years now I've been coming to look for fruit on this fig tree and haven't found any. Cut it down! Why should it use up the soil?'

verses.name: Luke 13:8
verses.text: "'Sir,' the man replied, 'leave it alone for one more year, and I'll dig around it and fertilize it.

verses.name: Luke 13:9
verses.text: If it bears fruit next year, fine! If not, then cut it down.'"

verses.name: Luke 13:10
verses.text: On a Sabbath Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues,

verses.name: Luke 13:11
verses.text: and a woman was there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.

verses.name: Luke 13:12
verses.text: When Jesus saw her, he called her forward and said to her, "Woman, you are set free from your infirmity."

verses.name: Luke 13:13
verses.text: Then he put his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up and praised God.

verses.name: Luke 13:14
verses.text: Indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, the synagogue ruler said to the people, "There are six days for work. So come and be healed on those days, not on the Sabbath."

verses.name: Luke 13:15
verses.text: The Lord answered him, "You hypocrites! Doesn't each of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or donkey from the stall and lead it out to give it water?

verses.name: Luke 13:16
verses.text: Then should not this woman, a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has kept bound for eighteen long years, be set free on the Sabbath day from what bound her?"

verses.name: Luke 13:17
verses.text: When he said this, all his opponents were humiliated, but the people were delighted with all the wonderful things he was doing.

verses.name: Luke 13:18
verses.text: Then Jesus asked, "What is the kingdom of God like? What shall I compare it to?

verses.name: Luke 13:19
verses.text: It is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds of the air perched in its branches."

verses.name: Luke 13:20
verses.text: Again he asked, "What shall I compare the kingdom of God to?

verses.name: Luke 13:21
verses.text: It is like yeast that a woman took and mixed into a large amount of flour until it worked all through the dough."

verses.name: Luke 13:22
verses.text: Then Jesus went through the towns and villages, teaching as he made his way to Jerusalem.

verses.name: Luke 13:23
verses.text: Someone asked him, "Lord, are only a few people going to be saved?"

verses.name: Luke 13:24
verses.text: He said to them, "Make every effort to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able to.

verses.name: Luke 13:25
verses.text: Once the owner of the house gets up and closes the door, you will stand outside knocking and pleading, 'Sir, open the door for us.'"But he will answer, 'I don't know you or where you come from.'

verses.name: Luke 13:26
verses.text: "Then you will say, 'We ate and drank with you, and you taught in our streets.'

verses.name: Luke 13:27
verses.text: "But he will reply, 'I don't know you or where you come from. Away from me, all you evildoers!'

verses.name: Luke 13:28
verses.text: "There will be weeping there, and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but you yourselves thrown out.

verses.name: Luke 13:29
verses.text: People will come from east and west and north and south, and will take their places at the feast in the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Luke 13:30
verses.text: Indeed there are those who are last who will be first, and first who will be last."

verses.name: Luke 13:31
verses.text: At that time some Pharisees came to Jesus and said to him, "Leave this place and go somewhere else. Herod wants to kill you."

verses.name: Luke 13:32
verses.text: He replied, "Go tell that fox, 'I will drive out demons and heal people today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will reach my goal.'

verses.name: Luke 13:33
verses.text: In any case, I must keep going today and tomorrow and the next day--for surely no prophet can die outside Jerusalem!

verses.name: Luke 13:34
verses.text: "O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing!

verses.name: Luke 13:35
verses.text: Look, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, 'Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.'"

verses.name: Luke 14:1
verses.text: One Sabbath, when Jesus went to eat in the house of a prominent Pharisee, he was being carefully watched.

verses.name: Luke 14:2
verses.text: There in front of him was a man suffering from dropsy.

verses.name: Luke 14:3
verses.text: Jesus asked the Pharisees and experts in the law, "Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?"

verses.name: Luke 14:4
verses.text: But they remained silent. So taking hold of the man, he healed him and sent him away.

verses.name: Luke 14:5
verses.text: Then he asked them, "If one of you has a son or an ox that falls into a well on the Sabbath day, will you not immediately pull him out?"

verses.name: Luke 14:6
verses.text: And they had nothing to say.

verses.name: Luke 14:7
verses.text: When he noticed how the guests picked the places of honor at the table, he told them this parable:

verses.name: Luke 14:8
verses.text: "When someone invites you to a wedding feast, do not take the place of honor, for a person more distinguished than you may have been invited.

verses.name: Luke 14:9
verses.text: If so, the host who invited both of you will come and say to you, 'Give this man your seat.' Then, humiliated, you will have to take the least important place.

verses.name: Luke 14:10
verses.text: But when you are invited, take the lowest place, so that when your host comes, he will say to you, 'Friend, move up to a better place.' Then you will be honored in the presence of all your fellow guests.

verses.name: Luke 14:11
verses.text: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted."

verses.name: Luke 14:12
verses.text: Then Jesus said to his host, "When you give a luncheon or dinner, do not invite your friends, your brothers or relatives, or your rich neighbors; if you do, they may invite you back and so you will be repaid.

verses.name: Luke 14:13
verses.text: But when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,

verses.name: Luke 14:14
verses.text: and you will be blessed. Although they cannot repay you, you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous."

verses.name: Luke 14:15
verses.text: When one of those at the table with him heard this, he said to Jesus, "Blessed is the man who will eat at the feast in the kingdom of God."

verses.name: Luke 14:16
verses.text: Jesus replied: "A certain man was preparing a great banquet and invited many guests.

verses.name: Luke 14:17
verses.text: At the time of the banquet he sent his servant to tell those who had been invited, 'Come, for everything is now ready.'

verses.name: Luke 14:18
verses.text: "But they all alike began to make excuses. The first said, 'I have just bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please excuse me.'

verses.name: Luke 14:19
verses.text: "Another said, 'I have just bought five yoke of oxen, and I'm on my way to try them out. Please excuse me.'

verses.name: Luke 14:20
verses.text: "Still another said, 'I just got married, so I can't come.'

verses.name: Luke 14:21
verses.text: "The servant came back and reported this to his master. Then the owner of the house became angry and ordered his servant, 'Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the town and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind and the lame.'

verses.name: Luke 14:22
verses.text: "'Sir,' the servant said, 'what you ordered has been done, but there is still room.'

verses.name: Luke 14:23
verses.text: "Then the master told his servant, 'Go out to the roads and country lanes and make them come in, so that my house will be full.

verses.name: Luke 14:24
verses.text: I tell you, not one of those men who were invited will get a taste of my banquet.'"

verses.name: Luke 14:25
verses.text: Large crowds were traveling with Jesus, and turning to them he said:

verses.name: Luke 14:26
verses.text: "If anyone comes to me and does not hate his father and mother, his wife and children, his brothers and sisters--yes, even his own life--he cannot be my disciple.

verses.name: Luke 14:27
verses.text: And anyone who does not carry his cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.

verses.name: Luke 14:28
verses.text: "Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. Will he not first sit down and estimate the cost to see if he has enough money to complete it?

verses.name: Luke 14:29
verses.text: For if he lays the foundation and is not able to finish it, everyone who sees it will ridicule him,

verses.name: Luke 14:30
verses.text: saying, 'This fellow began to build and was not able to finish.'

verses.name: Luke 14:31
verses.text: "Or suppose a king is about to go to war against another king. Will he not first sit down and consider whether he is able with ten thousand men to oppose the one coming against him with twenty thousand?

verses.name: Luke 14:32
verses.text: If he is not able, he will send a delegation while the other is still a long way off and will ask for terms of peace.

verses.name: Luke 14:33
verses.text: In the same way, any of you who does not give up everything he has cannot be my disciple.

verses.name: Luke 14:34
verses.text: "Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again?

verses.name: Luke 14:35
verses.text: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile; it is thrown out. "He who has ears to hear, let him hear."

verses.name: Luke 15:1
verses.text: Now the tax collectors and "sinners" were all gathering around to hear him.

verses.name: Luke 15:2
verses.text: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law muttered, "This man welcomes sinners and eats with them."

verses.name: Luke 15:3
verses.text: Then Jesus told them this parable:

verses.name: Luke 15:4
verses.text: "Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep and loses one of them. Does he not leave the ninety-nine in the open country and go after the lost sheep until he finds it?

verses.name: Luke 15:5
verses.text: And when he finds it, he joyfully puts it on his shoulders

verses.name: Luke 15:6
verses.text: and goes home. Then he calls his friends and neighbors together and says, 'Rejoice with me; I have found my lost sheep.'

verses.name: Luke 15:7
verses.text: I tell you that in the same way there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who do not need to repent.

verses.name: Luke 15:8
verses.text: "Or suppose a woman has ten silver coins and loses one. Does she not light a lamp, sweep the house and search carefully until she finds it?

verses.name: Luke 15:9
verses.text: And when she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together and says, 'Rejoice with me; I have found my lost coin.'

verses.name: Luke 15:10
verses.text: In the same way, I tell you, there is rejoicing in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents."

verses.name: Luke 15:11
verses.text: Jesus continued: "There was a man who had two sons.

verses.name: Luke 15:12
verses.text: The younger one said to his father, 'Father, give me my share of the estate.' So he divided his property between them.

verses.name: Luke 15:13
verses.text: "Not long after that, the younger son got together all he had, set off for a distant country and there squandered his wealth in wild living.

verses.name: Luke 15:14
verses.text: After he had spent everything, there was a severe famine in that whole country, and he began to be in need.

verses.name: Luke 15:15
verses.text: So he went and hired himself out to a citizen of that country, who sent him to his fields to feed pigs.

verses.name: Luke 15:16
verses.text: He longed to fill his stomach with the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.

verses.name: Luke 15:17
verses.text: "When he came to his senses, he said, 'How many of my father's hired men have food to spare, and here I am starving to death!

verses.name: Luke 15:18
verses.text: I will set out and go back to my father and say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.

verses.name: Luke 15:19
verses.text: I am no longer worthy to be called your son; make me like one of your hired men.'

verses.name: Luke 15:20
verses.text: So he got up and went to his father. "But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion for him; he ran to his son, threw his arms around him and kissed him.

verses.name: Luke 15:21
verses.text: "The son said to him, 'Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son. '

verses.name: Luke 15:22
verses.text: "But the father said to his servants, 'Quick! Bring the best robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.

verses.name: Luke 15:23
verses.text: Bring the fattened calf and kill it. Let's have a feast and celebrate.

verses.name: Luke 15:24
verses.text: For this son of mine was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.' So they began to celebrate.

verses.name: Luke 15:25
verses.text: "Meanwhile, the older son was in the field. When he came near the house, he heard music and dancing.

verses.name: Luke 15:26
verses.text: So he called one of the servants and asked him what was going on.

verses.name: Luke 15:27
verses.text: 'Your brother has come,' he replied, 'and your father has killed the fattened calf because he has him back safe and sound.'

verses.name: Luke 15:28
verses.text: "The older brother became angry and refused to go in. So his father went out and pleaded with him.

verses.name: Luke 15:29
verses.text: But he answered his father, 'Look! All these years I've been slaving for you and never disobeyed your orders. Yet you never gave me even a young goat so I could celebrate with my friends.

verses.name: Luke 15:30
verses.text: But when this son of yours who has squandered your property with prostitutes comes home, you kill the fattened calf for him!'

verses.name: Luke 15:31
verses.text: "'My son,' the father said, 'you are always with me, and everything I have is yours.

verses.name: Luke 15:32
verses.text: But we had to celebrate and be glad, because this brother of yours was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.'"

verses.name: Luke 16:1
verses.text: Jesus told his disciples: "There was a rich man whose manager was accused of wasting his possessions.

verses.name: Luke 16:2
verses.text: So he called him in and asked him, 'What is this I hear about you? Give an account of your management, because you cannot be manager any longer.'

verses.name: Luke 16:3
verses.text: "The manager said to himself, 'What shall I do now? My master is taking away my job. I'm not strong enough to dig, and I'm ashamed to beg--

verses.name: Luke 16:4
verses.text: I know what I'll do so that, when I lose my job here, people will welcome me into their houses.'

verses.name: Luke 16:5
verses.text: "So he called in each one of his master's debtors. He asked the first, 'How much do you owe my master?'

verses.name: Luke 16:6
verses.text: "'Eight hundred gallons of olive oil,' he replied. "The manager told him, 'Take your bill, sit down quickly, and make it four hundred.'

verses.name: Luke 16:7
verses.text: "Then he asked the second, 'And how much do you owe?'"'A thousand bushels of wheat,' he replied. "He told him, 'Take your bill and make it eight hundred.'

verses.name: Luke 16:8
verses.text: "The master commended the dishonest manager because he had acted shrewdly. For the people of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their own kind than are the people of the light.

verses.name: Luke 16:9
verses.text: I tell you, use worldly wealth to gain friends for yourselves, so that when it is gone, you will be welcomed into eternal dwellings.

verses.name: Luke 16:10
verses.text: "Whoever can be trusted with very little can also be trusted with much, and whoever is dishonest with very little will also be dishonest with much.

verses.name: Luke 16:11
verses.text: So if you have not been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will trust you with true riches?

verses.name: Luke 16:12
verses.text: And if you have not been trustworthy with someone else's property, who will give you property of your own?

verses.name: Luke 16:13
verses.text: "No servant can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and Money."

verses.name: Luke 16:14
verses.text: The Pharisees, who loved money, heard all this and were sneering at Jesus.

verses.name: Luke 16:15
verses.text: He said to them, "You are the ones who justify yourselves in the eyes of men, but God knows your hearts. What is highly valued among men is detestable in God's sight.

verses.name: Luke 16:16
verses.text: "The Law and the Prophets were proclaimed until John. Since that time, the good news of the kingdom of God is being preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.

verses.name: Luke 16:17
verses.text: It is easier for heaven and earth to disappear than for the least stroke of a pen to drop out of the Law.

verses.name: Luke 16:18
verses.text: "Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery, and the man who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.

verses.name: Luke 16:19
verses.text: "There was a rich man who was dressed in purple and fine linen and lived in luxury every day.

verses.name: Luke 16:20
verses.text: At his gate was laid a beggar named Lazarus, covered with sores

verses.name: Luke 16:21
verses.text: and longing to eat what fell from the rich man's table. Even the dogs came and licked his sores.

verses.name: Luke 16:22
verses.text: "The time came when the beggar died and the angels carried him to Abraham's side. The rich man also died and was buried.

verses.name: Luke 16:23
verses.text: In hell, where he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham far away, with Lazarus by his side.

verses.name: Luke 16:24
verses.text: So he called to him, 'Father Abraham, have pity on me and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in agony in this fire.'

verses.name: Luke 16:25
verses.text: "But Abraham replied, 'Son, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things, while Lazarus received bad things, but now he is comforted here and you are in agony.

verses.name: Luke 16:26
verses.text: And besides all this, between us and you a great chasm has been fixed, so that those who want to go from here to you cannot, nor can anyone cross over from there to us.'

verses.name: Luke 16:27
verses.text: "He answered, 'Then I beg you, father, send Lazarus to my father's house,

verses.name: Luke 16:28
verses.text: for I have five brothers. Let him warn them, so that they will not also come to this place of torment.'

verses.name: Luke 16:29
verses.text: "Abraham replied, 'They have Moses and the Prophets; let them listen to them.'

verses.name: Luke 16:30
verses.text: "'No, father Abraham,' he said, 'but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.'

verses.name: Luke 16:31
verses.text: "He said to him, 'If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, they will not be convinced even if someone rises from the dead.'"

verses.name: Luke 17:1
verses.text: Jesus said to his disciples: "Things that cause people to sin are bound to come, but woe to that person through whom they come.

verses.name: Luke 17:2
verses.text: It would be better for him to be thrown into the sea with a millstone tied around his neck than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.

verses.name: Luke 17:3
verses.text: So watch yourselves. "If your brother sins, rebuke him, and if he repents, forgive him.

verses.name: Luke 17:4
verses.text: If he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times comes back to you and says, 'I repent,' forgive him."

verses.name: Luke 17:5
verses.text: The apostles said to the Lord, "Increase our faith!"

verses.name: Luke 17:6
verses.text: He replied, "If you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mulberry tree, 'Be uprooted and planted in the sea,' and it will obey you.

verses.name: Luke 17:7
verses.text: "Suppose one of you had a servant plowing or looking after the sheep. Would he say to the servant when he comes in from the field, 'Come along now and sit down to eat'?

verses.name: Luke 17:8
verses.text: Would he not rather say, 'Prepare my supper, get yourself ready and wait on me while I eat and drink; after that you may eat and drink'?

verses.name: Luke 17:9
verses.text: Would he thank the servant because he did what he was told to do?

verses.name: Luke 17:10
verses.text: So you also, when you have done everything you were told to do, should say, 'We are unworthy servants; we have only done our duty.'"

verses.name: Luke 17:11
verses.text: Now on his way to Jerusalem, Jesus traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee.

verses.name: Luke 17:12
verses.text: As he was going into a village, ten men who had leprosy met him. They stood at a distance

verses.name: Luke 17:13
verses.text: and called out in a loud voice, "Jesus, Master, have pity on us!"

verses.name: Luke 17:14
verses.text: When he saw them, he said, "Go, show yourselves to the priests." And as they went, they were cleansed.

verses.name: Luke 17:15
verses.text: One of them, when he saw he was healed, came back, praising God in a loud voice.

verses.name: Luke 17:16
verses.text: He threw himself at Jesus' feet and thanked him--and he was a Samaritan.

verses.name: Luke 17:17
verses.text: Jesus asked, "Were not all ten cleansed? Where are the other nine?

verses.name: Luke 17:18
verses.text: Was no one found to return and give praise to God except this foreigner?"

verses.name: Luke 17:19
verses.text: Then he said to him, "Rise and go; your faith has made you well."

verses.name: Luke 17:20
verses.text: Once, having been asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, Jesus replied, "The kingdom of God does not come with your careful observation,

verses.name: Luke 17:21
verses.text: nor will people say, 'Here it is,' or 'There it is,' because the kingdom of God is within you."

verses.name: Luke 17:22
verses.text: Then he said to his disciples, "The time is coming when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, but you will not see it.

verses.name: Luke 17:23
verses.text: Men will tell you, 'There he is!' or 'Here he is!' Do not go running off after them.

verses.name: Luke 17:24
verses.text: For the Son of Man in his day will be like the lightning, which flashes and lights up the sky from one end to the other.

verses.name: Luke 17:25
verses.text: But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

verses.name: Luke 17:26
verses.text: "Just as it was in the days of Noah, so also will it be in the days of the Son of Man.

verses.name: Luke 17:27
verses.text: People were eating, drinking, marrying and being given in marriage up to the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.

verses.name: Luke 17:28
verses.text: "It was the same in the days of Lot. People were eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building.

verses.name: Luke 17:29
verses.text: But the day Lot left Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.

verses.name: Luke 17:30
verses.text: "It will be just like this on the day the Son of Man is revealed.

verses.name: Luke 17:31
verses.text: On that day no one who is on the roof of his house, with his goods inside, should go down to get them. Likewise, no one in the field should go back for anything.

verses.name: Luke 17:32
verses.text: Remember Lot's wife!

verses.name: Luke 17:33
verses.text: Whoever tries to keep his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life will preserve it.

verses.name: Luke 17:34
verses.text: I tell you, on that night two people will be in one bed; one will be taken and the other left.

verses.name: Luke 17:35
verses.text: Two women will be grinding grain together; one will be taken and the other left."

verses.name: Luke 17:36
verses.text: See Footnote

verses.name: Luke 17:37
verses.text: "Where, Lord?" they asked. He replied, "Where there is a dead body, there the vultures will gather."

verses.name: Luke 18:1
verses.text: Then Jesus told his disciples a parable to show them that they should always pray and not give up.

verses.name: Luke 18:2
verses.text: He said: "In a certain town there was a judge who neither feared God nor cared about men.

verses.name: Luke 18:3
verses.text: And there was a widow in that town who kept coming to him with the plea, 'Grant me justice against my adversary.'

verses.name: Luke 18:4
verses.text: "For some time he refused. But finally he said to himself, 'Even though I don't fear God or care about men,

verses.name: Luke 18:5
verses.text: yet because this widow keeps bothering me, I will see that she gets justice, so that she won't eventually wear me out with her coming!'"

verses.name: Luke 18:6
verses.text: And the Lord said, "Listen to what the unjust judge says.

verses.name: Luke 18:7
verses.text: And will not God bring about justice for his chosen ones, who cry out to him day and night? Will he keep putting them off?

verses.name: Luke 18:8
verses.text: I tell you, he will see that they get justice, and quickly. However, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?"

verses.name: Luke 18:9
verses.text: To some who were confident of their own righteousness and looked down on everybody else, Jesus told this parable:

verses.name: Luke 18:10
verses.text: "Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.

verses.name: Luke 18:11
verses.text: The Pharisee stood up and prayed about himself: 'God, I thank you that I am not like other men--robbers, evildoers, adulterers--or even like this tax collector.

verses.name: Luke 18:12
verses.text: I fast twice a week and give a tenth of all I get.'

verses.name: Luke 18:13
verses.text: "But the tax collector stood at a distance. He would not even look up to heaven, but beat his breast and said, 'God, have mercy on me, a sinner.'

verses.name: Luke 18:14
verses.text: "I tell you that this man, rather than the other, went home justified before God. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted."

verses.name: Luke 18:15
verses.text: People were also bringing babies to Jesus to have him touch them. When the disciples saw this, they rebuked them.

verses.name: Luke 18:16
verses.text: But Jesus called the children to him and said, "Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

verses.name: Luke 18:17
verses.text: I tell you the truth, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it."

verses.name: Luke 18:18
verses.text: A certain ruler asked him, "Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?"

verses.name: Luke 18:19
verses.text: "Why do you call me good?" Jesus answered. "No one is good--except God alone.

verses.name: Luke 18:20
verses.text: You know the commandments: 'Do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.'"

verses.name: Luke 18:21
verses.text: "All these I have kept since I was a boy," he said.

verses.name: Luke 18:22
verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, "You still lack one thing. Sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me."

verses.name: Luke 18:23
verses.text: When he heard this, he became very sad, because he was a man of great wealth.

verses.name: Luke 18:24
verses.text: Jesus looked at him and said, "How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!

verses.name: Luke 18:25
verses.text: Indeed, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God."

verses.name: Luke 18:26
verses.text: Those who heard this asked, "Who then can be saved?"

verses.name: Luke 18:27
verses.text: Jesus replied, "What is impossible with men is possible with God."

verses.name: Luke 18:28
verses.text: Peter said to him, "We have left all we had to follow you!"

verses.name: Luke 18:29
verses.text: "I tell you the truth," Jesus said to them, "no one who has left home or wife or brothers or parents or children for the sake of the kingdom of God

verses.name: Luke 18:30
verses.text: will fail to receive many times as much in this age and, in the age to come, eternal life."

verses.name: Luke 18:31
verses.text: Jesus took the Twelve aside and told them, "We are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be fulfilled.

verses.name: Luke 18:32
verses.text: He will be handed over to the Gentiles. They will mock him, insult him, spit on him, flog him and kill him.

verses.name: Luke 18:33
verses.text: On the third day he will rise again."

verses.name: Luke 18:34
verses.text: The disciples did not understand any of this. Its meaning was hidden from them, and they did not know what he was talking about.

verses.name: Luke 18:35
verses.text: As Jesus approached Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the roadside begging.

verses.name: Luke 18:36
verses.text: When he heard the crowd going by, he asked what was happening.

verses.name: Luke 18:37
verses.text: They told him, "Jesus of Nazareth is passing by."

verses.name: Luke 18:38
verses.text: He called out, "Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!"

verses.name: Luke 18:39
verses.text: Those who led the way rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, "Son of David, have mercy on me!"

verses.name: Luke 18:40
verses.text: Jesus stopped and ordered the man to be brought to him. When he came near, Jesus asked him,

verses.name: Luke 18:41
verses.text: "What do you want me to do for you?Lord, I want to see," he replied.

verses.name: Luke 18:42
verses.text: Jesus said to him, "Receive your sight; your faith has healed you."

verses.name: Luke 18:43
verses.text: Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus, praising God. When all the people saw it, they also praised God.

verses.name: Luke 19:1
verses.text: Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through.

verses.name: Luke 19:2
verses.text: A man was there by the name of Zacchaeus; he was a chief tax collector and was wealthy.

verses.name: Luke 19:3
verses.text: He wanted to see who Jesus was, but being a short man he could not, because of the crowd.

verses.name: Luke 19:4
verses.text: So he ran ahead and climbed a sycamore-fig tree to see him, since Jesus was coming that way.

verses.name: Luke 19:5
verses.text: When Jesus reached the spot, he looked up and said to him, "Zacchaeus, come down immediately. I must stay at your house today."

verses.name: Luke 19:6
verses.text: So he came down at once and welcomed him gladly.

verses.name: Luke 19:7
verses.text: All the people saw this and began to mutter, "He has gone to be the guest of a 'sinner.'"

verses.name: Luke 19:8
verses.text: But Zacchaeus stood up and said to the Lord, "Look, Lord! Here and now I give half of my possessions to the poor, and if I have cheated anybody out of anything, I will pay back four times the amount."

verses.name: Luke 19:9
verses.text: Jesus said to him, "Today salvation has come to this house, because this man, too, is a son of Abraham.

verses.name: Luke 19:10
verses.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save what was lost."

verses.name: Luke 19:11
verses.text: While they were listening to this, he went on to tell them a parable, because he was near Jerusalem and the people thought that the kingdom of God was going to appear at once.

verses.name: Luke 19:12
verses.text: He said: "A man of noble birth went to a distant country to have himself appointed king and then to return.

verses.name: Luke 19:13
verses.text: So he called ten of his servants and gave them ten minas. 'Put this money to work,' he said, 'until I come back.'

verses.name: Luke 19:14
verses.text: "But his subjects hated him and sent a delegation after him to say, 'We don't want this man to be our king.'

verses.name: Luke 19:15
verses.text: "He was made king, however, and returned home. Then he sent for the servants to whom he had given the money, in order to find out what they had gained with it.

verses.name: Luke 19:16
verses.text: "The first one came and said, 'Sir, your mina has earned ten more.'

verses.name: Luke 19:17
verses.text: "'Well done, my good servant!' his master replied. 'Because you have been trustworthy in a very small matter, take charge of ten cities.'

verses.name: Luke 19:18
verses.text: "The second came and said, 'Sir, your mina has earned five more.'

verses.name: Luke 19:19
verses.text: "His master answered, 'You take charge of five cities.'

verses.name: Luke 19:20
verses.text: "Then another servant came and said, 'Sir, here is your mina; I have kept it laid away in a piece of cloth.

verses.name: Luke 19:21
verses.text: I was afraid of you, because you are a hard man. You take out what you did not put in and reap what you did not sow.'

verses.name: Luke 19:22
verses.text: "His master replied, 'I will judge you by your own words, you wicked servant! You knew, did you, that I am a hard man, taking out what I did not put in, and reaping what I did not sow?

verses.name: Luke 19:23
verses.text: Why then didn't you put my money on deposit, so that when I came back, I could have collected it with interest?'

verses.name: Luke 19:24
verses.text: "Then he said to those standing by, 'Take his mina away from him and give it to the one who has ten minas.'

verses.name: Luke 19:25
verses.text: "'Sir,' they said, 'he already has ten!'

verses.name: Luke 19:26
verses.text: "He replied, 'I tell you that to everyone who has, more will be given, but as for the one who has nothing, even what he has will be taken away.

verses.name: Luke 19:27
verses.text: But those enemies of mine who did not want me to be king over them--bring them here and kill them in front of me.'"

verses.name: Luke 19:28
verses.text: After Jesus had said this, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.

verses.name: Luke 19:29
verses.text: As he approached Bethphage and Bethany at the hill called the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples, saying to them,

verses.name: Luke 19:30
verses.text: "Go to the village ahead of you, and as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.

verses.name: Luke 19:31
verses.text: If anyone asks you, 'Why are you untying it?' tell him, 'The Lord needs it.'"

verses.name: Luke 19:32
verses.text: Those who were sent ahead went and found it just as he had told them.

verses.name: Luke 19:33
verses.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, "Why are you untying the colt?"

verses.name: Luke 19:34
verses.text: They replied, "The Lord needs it."

verses.name: Luke 19:35
verses.text: They brought it to Jesus, threw their cloaks on the colt and put Jesus on it.

verses.name: Luke 19:36
verses.text: As he went along, people spread their cloaks on the road.

verses.name: Luke 19:37
verses.text: When he came near the place where the road goes down the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of disciples began joyfully to praise God in loud voices for all the miracles they had seen:

verses.name: Luke 19:38
verses.text: "Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord!Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!"

verses.name: Luke 19:39
verses.text: Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to Jesus, "Teacher, rebuke your disciples!"

verses.name: Luke 19:40
verses.text: "I tell you," he replied, "if they keep quiet, the stones will cry out."

verses.name: Luke 19:41
verses.text: As he approached Jerusalem and saw the city, he wept over it

verses.name: Luke 19:42
verses.text: and said, "If you, even you, had only known on this day what would bring you peace--but now it is hidden from your eyes.

verses.name: Luke 19:43
verses.text: The days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment against you and encircle you and hem you in on every side.

verses.name: Luke 19:44
verses.text: They will dash you to the ground, you and the children within your walls. They will not leave one stone on another, because you did not recognize the time of God's coming to you."

verses.name: Luke 19:45
verses.text: Then he entered the temple area and began driving out those who were selling.

verses.name: Luke 19:46
verses.text: "It is written," he said to them, "'My house will be a house of prayer'; but you have made it 'a den of robbers.'"

verses.name: Luke 19:47
verses.text: Every day he was teaching at the temple. But the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the leaders among the people were trying to kill him.

verses.name: Luke 19:48
verses.text: Yet they could not find any way to do it, because all the people hung on his words.

verses.name: Luke 20:1
verses.text: One day as he was teaching the people in the temple courts and preaching the gospel, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, together with the elders, came up to him.

verses.name: Luke 20:2
verses.text: "Tell us by what authority you are doing these things," they said. "Who gave you this authority?"

verses.name: Luke 20:3
verses.text: He replied, "I will also ask you a question. Tell me,

verses.name: Luke 20:4
verses.text: John's baptism--was it from heaven, or from men?"

verses.name: Luke 20:5
verses.text: They discussed it among themselves and said, "If we say, 'From heaven,' he will ask, 'Why didn't you believe him?'

verses.name: Luke 20:6
verses.text: But if we say, 'From men,' all the people will stone us, because they are persuaded that John was a prophet."

verses.name: Luke 20:7
verses.text: So they answered, "We don't know where it was from."

verses.name: Luke 20:8
verses.text: Jesus said, "Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things."

verses.name: Luke 20:9
verses.text: He went on to tell the people this parable: "A man planted a vineyard, rented it to some farmers and went away for a long time.

verses.name: Luke 20:10
verses.text: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants so they would give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the tenants beat him and sent him away empty-handed.

verses.name: Luke 20:11
verses.text: He sent another servant, but that one also they beat and treated shamefully and sent away empty-handed.

verses.name: Luke 20:12
verses.text: He sent still a third, and they wounded him and threw him out.

verses.name: Luke 20:13
verses.text: "Then the owner of the vineyard said, 'What shall I do? I will send my son, whom I love; perhaps they will respect him.'

verses.name: Luke 20:14
verses.text: "But when the tenants saw him, they talked the matter over. 'This is the heir,' they said. 'Let's kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.'

verses.name: Luke 20:15
verses.text: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

verses.name: Luke 20:16
verses.text: "What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them? He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others." When the people heard this, they said, "May this never be!"

verses.name: Luke 20:17
verses.text: Jesus looked directly at them and asked, "Then what is the meaning of that which is written: "'The stone the builders rejected has become the capstone '?

verses.name: Luke 20:18
verses.text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed."

verses.name: Luke 20:19
verses.text: The teachers of the law and the chief priests looked for a way to arrest him immediately, because they knew he had spoken this parable against them. But they were afraid of the people.

verses.name: Luke 20:20
verses.text: Keeping a close watch on him, they sent spies, who pretended to be honest. They hoped to catch Jesus in something he said so that they might hand him over to the power and authority of the governor.

verses.name: Luke 20:21
verses.text: So the spies questioned him: "Teacher, we know that you speak and teach what is right, and that you do not show partiality but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth.

verses.name: Luke 20:22
verses.text: Is it right for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?"

verses.name: Luke 20:23
verses.text: He saw through their duplicity and said to them,

verses.name: Luke 20:24
verses.text: "Show me a denarius. Whose portrait and inscription are on it?"

verses.name: Luke 20:25
verses.text: "Caesar's," they replied. He said to them, "Then give to Caesar what is Caesar's, and to God what is God's."

verses.name: Luke 20:26
verses.text: They were unable to trap him in what he had said there in public. And astonished by his answer, they became silent.

verses.name: Luke 20:27
verses.text: Some of the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Jesus with a question.

verses.name: Luke 20:28
verses.text: "Teacher," they said, "Moses wrote for us that if a man's brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and have children for his brother.

verses.name: Luke 20:29
verses.text: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married a woman and died childless.

verses.name: Luke 20:30
verses.text: The second

verses.name: Luke 20:31
verses.text: and then the third married her, and in the same way the seven died, leaving no children.

verses.name: Luke 20:32
verses.text: Finally, the woman died too.

verses.name: Luke 20:33
verses.text: Now then, at the resurrection whose wife will she be, since the seven were married to her?"

verses.name: Luke 20:34
verses.text: Jesus replied, "The people of this age marry and are given in marriage.

verses.name: Luke 20:35
verses.text: But those who are considered worthy of taking part in that age and in the resurrection from the dead will neither marry nor be given in marriage,

verses.name: Luke 20:36
verses.text: and they can no longer die; for they are like the angels. They are God's children, since they are children of the resurrection.

verses.name: Luke 20:37
verses.text: But in the account of the bush, even Moses showed that the dead rise, for he calls the Lord 'the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.'

verses.name: Luke 20:38
verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for to him all are alive."

verses.name: Luke 20:39
verses.text: Some of the teachers of the law responded, "Well said, teacher!"

verses.name: Luke 20:40
verses.text: And no one dared to ask him any more questions.

verses.name: Luke 20:41
verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, "How is it that they say the Christ is the Son of David?

verses.name: Luke 20:42
verses.text: David himself declares in the Book of Psalms: "'The Lord said to my Lord: "Sit at my right hand

verses.name: Luke 20:43
verses.text: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet."'

verses.name: Luke 20:44
verses.text: David calls him 'Lord.' How then can he be his son?"

verses.name: Luke 20:45
verses.text: While all the people were listening, Jesus said to his disciples,

verses.name: Luke 20:46
verses.text: "Beware of the teachers of the law. They like to walk around in flowing robes and love to be greeted in the marketplaces and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.

verses.name: Luke 20:47
verses.text: They devour widows' houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. Such men will be punished most severely."

verses.name: Luke 21:1
verses.text: As he looked up, Jesus saw the rich putting their gifts into the temple treasury.

verses.name: Luke 21:2
verses.text: He also saw a poor widow put in two very small copper coins.

verses.name: Luke 21:3
verses.text: "I tell you the truth," he said, "this poor widow has put in more than all the others.

verses.name: Luke 21:4
verses.text: All these people gave their gifts out of their wealth; but she out of her poverty put in all she had to live on."

verses.name: Luke 21:5
verses.text: Some of his disciples were remarking about how the temple was adorned with beautiful stones and with gifts dedicated to God. But Jesus said,

verses.name: Luke 21:6
verses.text: "As for what you see here, the time will come when not one stone will be left on another; every one of them will be thrown down."

verses.name: Luke 21:7
verses.text: "Teacher," they asked, "when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are about to take place?"

verses.name: Luke 21:8
verses.text: He replied: "Watch out that you are not deceived. For many will come in my name, claiming, 'I am he,' and, 'The time is near.' Do not follow them.

verses.name: Luke 21:9
verses.text: When you hear of wars and revolutions, do not be frightened. These things must happen first, but the end will not come right away."

verses.name: Luke 21:10
verses.text: Then he said to them: "Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

verses.name: Luke 21:11
verses.text: There will be great earthquakes, famines and pestilences in various places, and fearful events and great signs from heaven.

verses.name: Luke 21:12
verses.text: "But before all this, they will lay hands on you and persecute you. They will deliver you to synagogues and prisons, and you will be brought before kings and governors, and all on account of my name.

verses.name: Luke 21:13
verses.text: This will result in your being witnesses to them.

verses.name: Luke 21:14
verses.text: But make up your mind not to worry beforehand how you will defend yourselves.

verses.name: Luke 21:15
verses.text: For I will give you words and wisdom that none of your adversaries will be able to resist or contradict.

verses.name: Luke 21:16
verses.text: You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers, relatives and friends, and they will put some of you to death.

verses.name: Luke 21:17
verses.text: All men will hate you because of me.

verses.name: Luke 21:18
verses.text: But not a hair of your head will perish.

verses.name: Luke 21:19
verses.text: By standing firm you will gain life.

verses.name: Luke 21:20
verses.text: "When you see Jerusalem being surrounded by armies, you will know that its desolation is near.

verses.name: Luke 21:21
verses.text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, let those in the city get out, and let those in the country not enter the city.

verses.name: Luke 21:22
verses.text: For this is the time of punishment in fulfillment of all that has been written.

verses.name: Luke 21:23
verses.text: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers! There will be great distress in the land and wrath against this people.

verses.name: Luke 21:24
verses.text: They will fall by the sword and will be taken as prisoners to all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled on by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

verses.name: Luke 21:25
verses.text: "There will be signs in the sun, moon and stars. On the earth, nations will be in anguish and perplexity at the roaring and tossing of the sea.

verses.name: Luke 21:26
verses.text: Men will faint from terror, apprehensive of what is coming on the world, for the heavenly bodies will be shaken.

verses.name: Luke 21:27
verses.text: At that time they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

verses.name: Luke 21:28
verses.text: When these things begin to take place, stand up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is drawing near."

verses.name: Luke 21:29
verses.text: He told them this parable: "Look at the fig tree and all the trees.

verses.name: Luke 21:30
verses.text: When they sprout leaves, you can see for yourselves and know that summer is near.

verses.name: Luke 21:31
verses.text: Even so, when you see these things happening, you know that the kingdom of God is near.

verses.name: Luke 21:32
verses.text: "I tell you the truth, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

verses.name: Luke 21:33
verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

verses.name: Luke 21:34
verses.text: "Be careful, or your hearts will be weighed down with dissipation, drunkenness and the anxieties of life, and that day will close on you unexpectedly like a trap.

verses.name: Luke 21:35
verses.text: For it will come upon all those who live on the face of the whole earth.

verses.name: Luke 21:36
verses.text: Be always on the watch, and pray that you may be able to escape all that is about to happen, and that you may be able to stand before the Son of Man."

verses.name: Luke 21:37
verses.text: Each day Jesus was teaching at the temple, and each evening he went out to spend the night on the hill called the Mount of Olives,

verses.name: Luke 21:38
verses.text: and all the people came early in the morning to hear him at the temple.

verses.name: Luke 22:1
verses.text: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread, called the Passover, was approaching,

verses.name: Luke 22:2
verses.text: and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were looking for some way to get rid of Jesus, for they were afraid of the people.

verses.name: Luke 22:3
verses.text: Then Satan entered Judas, called Iscariot, one of the Twelve.

verses.name: Luke 22:4
verses.text: And Judas went to the chief priests and the officers of the temple guard and discussed with them how he might betray Jesus.

verses.name: Luke 22:5
verses.text: They were delighted and agreed to give him money.

verses.name: Luke 22:6
verses.text: He consented, and watched for an opportunity to hand Jesus over to them when no crowd was present.

verses.name: Luke 22:7
verses.text: Then came the day of Unleavened Bread on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.

verses.name: Luke 22:8
verses.text: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, "Go and make preparations for us to eat the Passover."

verses.name: Luke 22:9
verses.text: "Where do you want us to prepare for it?" they asked.

verses.name: Luke 22:10
verses.text: He replied, "As you enter the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him to the house that he enters,

verses.name: Luke 22:11
verses.text: and say to the owner of the house, 'The Teacher asks: Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?'

verses.name: Luke 22:12
verses.text: He will show you a large upper room, all furnished. Make preparations there."

verses.name: Luke 22:13
verses.text: They left and found things just as Jesus had told them. So they prepared the Passover.

verses.name: Luke 22:14
verses.text: When the hour came, Jesus and his apostles reclined at the table.

verses.name: Luke 22:15
verses.text: And he said to them, "I have eagerly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

verses.name: Luke 22:16
verses.text: For I tell you, I will not eat it again until it finds fulfillment in the kingdom of God."

verses.name: Luke 22:17
verses.text: After taking the cup, he gave thanks and said, "Take this and divide it among you.

verses.name: Luke 22:18
verses.text: For I tell you I will not drink again of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes."

verses.name: Luke 22:19
verses.text: And he took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, "This is my body given for you; do this in remembrance of me."

verses.name: Luke 22:20
verses.text: In the same way, after the supper he took the cup, saying, "This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.

verses.name: Luke 22:21
verses.text: But the hand of him who is going to betray me is with mine on the table.

verses.name: Luke 22:22
verses.text: The Son of Man will go as it has been decreed, but woe to that man who betrays him."

verses.name: Luke 22:23
verses.text: They began to question among themselves which of them it might be who would do this.

verses.name: Luke 22:24
verses.text: Also a dispute arose among them as to which of them was considered to be greatest.

verses.name: Luke 22:25
verses.text: Jesus said to them, "The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them; and those who exercise authority over them call themselves Benefactors.

verses.name: Luke 22:26
verses.text: But you are not to be like that. Instead, the greatest among you should be like the youngest, and the one who rules like the one who serves.

verses.name: Luke 22:27
verses.text: For who is greater, the one who is at the table or the one who serves? Is it not the one who is at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.

verses.name: Luke 22:28
verses.text: You are those who have stood by me in my trials.

verses.name: Luke 22:29
verses.text: And I confer on you a kingdom, just as my Father conferred one on me,

verses.name: Luke 22:30
verses.text: so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom and sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.name: Luke 22:31
verses.text: "Simon, Simon, Satan has asked to sift you as wheat.

verses.name: Luke 22:32
verses.text: But I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith may not fail. And when you have turned back, strengthen your brothers."

verses.name: Luke 22:33
verses.text: But he replied, "Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and to death."

verses.name: Luke 22:34
verses.text: Jesus answered, "I tell you, Peter, before the rooster crows today, you will deny three times that you know me."

verses.name: Luke 22:35
verses.text: Then Jesus asked them, "When I sent you without purse, bag or sandals, did you lack anything?Nothing," they answered.

verses.name: Luke 22:36
verses.text: He said to them, "But now if you have a purse, take it, and also a bag; and if you don't have a sword, sell your cloak and buy one.

verses.name: Luke 22:37
verses.text: It is written: 'And he was numbered with the transgressors'; and I tell you that this must be fulfilled in me. Yes, what is written about me is reaching its fulfillment."

verses.name: Luke 22:38
verses.text: The disciples said, "See, Lord, here are two swords.That is enough," he replied.

verses.name: Luke 22:39
verses.text: Jesus went out as usual to the Mount of Olives, and his disciples followed him.

verses.name: Luke 22:40
verses.text: On reaching the place, he said to them, "Pray that you will not fall into temptation."

verses.name: Luke 22:41
verses.text: He withdrew about a stone's throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed,

verses.name: Luke 22:42
verses.text: "Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."

verses.name: Luke 22:43
verses.text: An angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.

verses.name: Luke 22:44
verses.text: And being in anguish, he prayed more earnestly, and his sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.

verses.name: Luke 22:45
verses.text: When he rose from prayer and went back to the disciples, he found them asleep, exhausted from sorrow.

verses.name: Luke 22:46
verses.text: "Why are you sleeping?" he asked them. "Get up and pray so that you will not fall into temptation."

verses.name: Luke 22:47
verses.text: While he was still speaking a crowd came up, and the man who was called Judas, one of the Twelve, was leading them. He approached Jesus to kiss him,

verses.name: Luke 22:48
verses.text: but Jesus asked him, "Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?"

verses.name: Luke 22:49
verses.text: When Jesus' followers saw what was going to happen, they said, "Lord, should we strike with our swords?"

verses.name: Luke 22:50
verses.text: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his right ear.

verses.name: Luke 22:51
verses.text: But Jesus answered, "No more of this!" And he touched the man's ear and healed him.

verses.name: Luke 22:52
verses.text: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, the officers of the temple guard, and the elders, who had come for him, "Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come with swords and clubs?

verses.name: Luke 22:53
verses.text: Every day I was with you in the temple courts, and you did not lay a hand on me. But this is your hour--when darkness reigns."

verses.name: Luke 22:54
verses.text: Then seizing him, they led him away and took him into the house of the high priest. Peter followed at a distance.

verses.name: Luke 22:55
verses.text: But when they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and had sat down together, Peter sat down with them.

verses.name: Luke 22:56
verses.text: A servant girl saw him seated there in the firelight. She looked closely at him and said, "This man was with him."

verses.name: Luke 22:57
verses.text: But he denied it. "Woman, I don't know him," he said.

verses.name: Luke 22:58
verses.text: A little later someone else saw him and said, "You also are one of them.Man, I am not!" Peter replied.

verses.name: Luke 22:59
verses.text: About an hour later another asserted, "Certainly this fellow was with him, for he is a Galilean."

verses.name: Luke 22:60
verses.text: Peter replied, "Man, I don't know what you're talking about!" Just as he was speaking, the rooster crowed.

verses.name: Luke 22:61
verses.text: The Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word the Lord had spoken to him: "Before the rooster crows today, you will disown me three times."

verses.name: Luke 22:62
verses.text: And he went outside and wept bitterly.

verses.name: Luke 22:63
verses.text: The men who were guarding Jesus began mocking and beating him.

verses.name: Luke 22:64
verses.text: They blindfolded him and demanded, "Prophesy! Who hit you?"

verses.name: Luke 22:65
verses.text: And they said many other insulting things to him.

verses.name: Luke 22:66
verses.text: At daybreak the council of the elders of the people, both the chief priests and teachers of the law, met together, and Jesus was led before them.

verses.name: Luke 22:67
verses.text: "If you are the Christ, "they said, "tell us."

verses.name: Luke 22:68
verses.text: Jesus answered, "If I tell you, you will not believe me, and if I asked you, you would not answer.

verses.name: Luke 22:69
verses.text: But from now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the mighty God."

verses.name: Luke 22:70
verses.text: They all asked, "Are you then the Son of God?" He replied, "You are right in saying I am."

verses.name: Luke 22:71
verses.text: Then they said, "Why do we need any more testimony? We have heard it from his own lips."

verses.name: Luke 23:1
verses.text: Then the whole assembly rose and led him off to Pilate.

verses.name: Luke 23:2
verses.text: And they began to accuse him, saying, "We have found this man subverting our nation. He opposes payment of taxes to Caesar and claims to be Christ, a king."

verses.name: Luke 23:3
verses.text: So Pilate asked Jesus, "Are you the king of the Jews?Yes, it is as you say," Jesus replied.

verses.name: Luke 23:4
verses.text: Then Pilate announced to the chief priests and the crowd, "I find no basis for a charge against this man."

verses.name: Luke 23:5
verses.text: But they insisted, "He stirs up the people all over Judea by his teaching. He started in Galilee and has come all the way here."

verses.name: Luke 23:6
verses.text: On hearing this, Pilate asked if the man was a Galilean.

verses.name: Luke 23:7
verses.text: When he learned that Jesus was under Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem at that time.

verses.name: Luke 23:8
verses.text: When Herod saw Jesus, he was greatly pleased, because for a long time he had been wanting to see him. From what he had heard about him, he hoped to see him perform some miracle.

verses.name: Luke 23:9
verses.text: He plied him with many questions, but Jesus gave him no answer.

verses.name: Luke 23:10
verses.text: The chief priests and the teachers of the law were standing there, vehemently accusing him.

verses.name: Luke 23:11
verses.text: Then Herod and his soldiers ridiculed and mocked him. Dressing him in an elegant robe, they sent him back to Pilate.

verses.name: Luke 23:12
verses.text: That day Herod and Pilate became friends--before this they had been enemies.

verses.name: Luke 23:13
verses.text: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers and the people,

verses.name: Luke 23:14
verses.text: and said to them, "You brought me this man as one who was inciting the people to rebellion. I have examined him in your presence and have found no basis for your charges against him.

verses.name: Luke 23:15
verses.text: Neither has Herod, for he sent him back to us; as you can see, he has done nothing to deserve death.

verses.name: Luke 23:16
verses.text: Therefore, I will punish him and then release him."

verses.name: Luke 23:17
verses.text: See Footnote

verses.name: Luke 23:18
verses.text: With one voice they cried out, "Away with this man! Release Barabbas to us!"

verses.name: Luke 23:19
verses.text: (Barabbas had been thrown into prison for an insurrection in the city, and for murder.)

verses.name: Luke 23:20
verses.text: Wanting to release Jesus, Pilate appealed to them again.

verses.name: Luke 23:21
verses.text: But they kept shouting, "Crucify him! Crucify him!"

verses.name: Luke 23:22
verses.text: For the third time he spoke to them: "Why? What crime has this man committed? I have found in him no grounds for the death penalty. Therefore I will have him punished and then release him."

verses.name: Luke 23:23
verses.text: But with loud shouts they insistently demanded that he be crucified, and their shouts prevailed.

verses.name: Luke 23:24
verses.text: So Pilate decided to grant their demand.

verses.name: Luke 23:25
verses.text: He released the man who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, the one they asked for, and surrendered Jesus to their will.

verses.name: Luke 23:26
verses.text: As they led him away, they seized Simon from Cyrene, who was on his way in from the country, and put the cross on him and made him carry it behind Jesus.

verses.name: Luke 23:27
verses.text: A large number of people followed him, including women who mourned and wailed for him.

verses.name: Luke 23:28
verses.text: Jesus turned and said to them, "Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me; weep for yourselves and for your children.

verses.name: Luke 23:29
verses.text: For the time will come when you will say, 'Blessed are the barren women, the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed!'

verses.name: Luke 23:30
verses.text: Then "'they will say to the mountains, "Fall on us!" and to the hills, "Cover us!"'

verses.name: Luke 23:31
verses.text: For if men do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?"

verses.name: Luke 23:32
verses.text: Two other men, both criminals, were also led out with him to be executed.

verses.name: Luke 23:33
verses.text: When they came to the place called the Skull, there they crucified him, along with the criminals--one on his right, the other on his left.

verses.name: Luke 23:34
verses.text: Jesus said, "Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing." And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.

verses.name: Luke 23:35
verses.text: The people stood watching, and the rulers even sneered at him. They said, "He saved others; let him save himself if he is the Christ of God, the Chosen One."

verses.name: Luke 23:36
verses.text: The soldiers also came up and mocked him. They offered him wine vinegar

verses.name: Luke 23:37
verses.text: and said, "If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself."

verses.name: Luke 23:38
verses.text: There was a written notice above him, which read:|sc THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.name: Luke 23:39
verses.text: One of the criminals who hung there hurled insults at him: "Aren't you the Christ? Save yourself and us!"

verses.name: Luke 23:40
verses.text: But the other criminal rebuked him. "Don't you fear God," he said, "since you are under the same sentence?

verses.name: Luke 23:41
verses.text: We are punished justly, for we are getting what our deeds deserve. But this man has done nothing wrong."

verses.name: Luke 23:42
verses.text: Then he said, "Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom. "

verses.name: Luke 23:43
verses.text: Jesus answered him, "I tell you the truth, today you will be with me in paradise."

verses.name: Luke 23:44
verses.text: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour,

verses.name: Luke 23:45
verses.text: for the sun stopped shining. And the curtain of the temple was torn in two.

verses.name: Luke 23:46
