verses.text: Jesus called out with a loud voice, "Father, into your hands I commit my spirit." When he had said this, he breathed his last.

verses.name: Luke 23:47
verses.text: The centurion, seeing what had happened, praised God and said, "Surely this was a righteous man."

verses.name: Luke 23:48
verses.text: When all the people who had gathered to witness this sight saw what took place, they beat their breasts and went away.

verses.name: Luke 23:49
verses.text: But all those who knew him, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.

verses.name: Luke 23:50
verses.text: Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the Council, a good and upright man,

verses.name: Luke 23:51
verses.text: who had not consented to their decision and action. He came from the Judean town of Arimathea and he was waiting for the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Luke 23:52
verses.text: Going to Pilate, he asked for Jesus' body.

verses.name: Luke 23:53
verses.text: Then he took it down, wrapped it in linen cloth and placed it in a tomb cut in the rock, one in which no one had yet been laid.

verses.name: Luke 23:54
verses.text: It was Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was about to begin.

verses.name: Luke 23:55
verses.text: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed Joseph and saw the tomb and how his body was laid in it.

verses.name: Luke 23:56
verses.text: Then they went home and prepared spices and perfumes. But they rested on the Sabbath in obedience to the commandment.

verses.name: Luke 24:1
verses.text: On the first day of the week, very early in the morning, the women took the spices they had prepared and went to the tomb.

verses.name: Luke 24:2
verses.text: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb,

verses.name: Luke 24:3
verses.text: but when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.

verses.name: Luke 24:4
verses.text: While they were wondering about this, suddenly two men in clothes that gleamed like lightning stood beside them.

verses.name: Luke 24:5
verses.text: In their fright the women bowed down with their faces to the ground, but the men said to them, "Why do you look for the living among the dead?

verses.name: Luke 24:6
verses.text: He is not here; he has risen! Remember how he told you, while he was still with you in Galilee:

verses.name: Luke 24:7
verses.text: 'The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, be crucified and on the third day be raised again.'"

verses.name: Luke 24:8
verses.text: Then they remembered his words.

verses.name: Luke 24:9
verses.text: When they came back from the tomb, they told all these things to the Eleven and to all the others.

verses.name: Luke 24:10
verses.text: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the others with them who told this to the apostles.

verses.name: Luke 24:11
verses.text: But they did not believe the women, because their words seemed to them like nonsense.

verses.name: Luke 24:12
verses.text: Peter, however, got up and ran to the tomb. Bending over, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he went away, wondering to himself what had happened.

verses.name: Luke 24:13
verses.text: Now that same day two of them were going to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.

verses.name: Luke 24:14
verses.text: They were talking with each other about everything that had happened.

verses.name: Luke 24:15
verses.text: As they talked and discussed these things with each other, Jesus himself came up and walked along with them;

verses.name: Luke 24:16
verses.text: but they were kept from recognizing him.

verses.name: Luke 24:17
verses.text: He asked them, "What are you discussing together as you walk along?"

verses.name: Luke 24:18
verses.text: They stood still, their faces downcast. One of them, named Cleopas, asked him, "Are you only a visitor to Jerusalem and do not know the things that have happened there in these days?"

verses.name: Luke 24:19
verses.text: "What things?" he asked.

verses.name: Luke 24:20
verses.text: "About Jesus of Nazareth," they replied. "He was a prophet, powerful in word and deed before God and all the people. The chief priests and our rulers handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him;

verses.name: Luke 24:21
verses.text: but we had hoped that he was the one who was going to redeem Israel. And what is more, it is the third day since all this took place.

verses.name: Luke 24:22
verses.text: In addition, some of our women amazed us. They went to the tomb early this morning

verses.name: Luke 24:23
verses.text: but didn't find his body. They came and told us that they had seen a vision of angels, who said he was alive.

verses.name: Luke 24:24
verses.text: Then some of our companions went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said, but him they did not see."

verses.name: Luke 24:25
verses.text: He said to them, "How foolish you are, and how slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!

verses.name: Luke 24:26
verses.text: Did not the Christ have to suffer these things and then enter his glory?"

verses.name: Luke 24:27
verses.text: And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, he explained to them what was said in all the Scriptures concerning himself.

verses.name: Luke 24:28
verses.text: As they approached the village to which they were going, Jesus acted as if he were going farther.

verses.name: Luke 24:29
verses.text: But they urged him strongly, "Stay with us, for it is nearly evening; the day is almost over." So he went in to stay with them.

verses.name: Luke 24:30
verses.text: When he was at the table with them, he took bread, gave thanks, broke it and began to give it to them.

verses.name: Luke 24:31
verses.text: Then their eyes were opened and they recognized him, and he disappeared from their sight.

verses.name: Luke 24:32
verses.text: They asked each other, "Were not our hearts burning within us while he talked with us on the road and opened the Scriptures to us?"

verses.name: Luke 24:33
verses.text: They got up and returned at once to Jerusalem. There they found the Eleven and those with them, assembled together

verses.name: Luke 24:34
verses.text: and saying, "It is true! The Lord has risen and has appeared to Simon."

verses.name: Luke 24:35
verses.text: Then the two told what had happened on the way, and how Jesus was recognized by them when he broke the bread.

verses.name: Luke 24:36
verses.text: While they were still talking about this, Jesus himself stood among them and said to them, "Peace be with you."

verses.name: Luke 24:37
verses.text: They were startled and frightened, thinking they saw a ghost.

verses.name: Luke 24:38
verses.text: He said to them, "Why are you troubled, and why do doubts rise in your minds?

verses.name: Luke 24:39
verses.text: Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself! Touch me and see; a ghost does not have flesh and bones, as you see I have."

verses.name: Luke 24:40
verses.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and feet.

verses.name: Luke 24:41
verses.text: And while they still did not believe it because of joy and amazement, he asked them, "Do you have anything here to eat?"

verses.name: Luke 24:42
verses.text: They gave him a piece of broiled fish,

verses.name: Luke 24:43
verses.text: and he took it and ate it in their presence.

verses.name: Luke 24:44
verses.text: He said to them, "This is what I told you while I was still with you: Everything must be fulfilled that is written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets and the Psalms."

verses.name: Luke 24:45
verses.text: Then he opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.

verses.name: Luke 24:46
verses.text: He told them, "This is what is written: The Christ will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day,

verses.name: Luke 24:47
verses.text: and repentance and forgiveness of sins will be preached in his name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

verses.name: Luke 24:48
verses.text: You are witnesses of these things.

verses.name: Luke 24:49
verses.text: I am going to send you what my Father has promised; but stay in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high."

verses.name: Luke 24:50
verses.text: When he had led them out to the vicinity of Bethany, he lifted up his hands and blessed them.

verses.name: Luke 24:51
verses.text: While he was blessing them, he left them and was taken up into heaven.

verses.name: Luke 24:52
verses.text: Then they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.

verses.name: Luke 24:53
verses.text: And they stayed continually at the temple, praising God.
